review: 2020 After 8 years playing it, I didn't improve my skills in-game.However, I learned new language skills: now I can curse in Russian and Brazilian Portuguese.Also, my tolerance level to guttural screams and loud sounds was increased.Now I can bear the crying of my children for longer and I can make them feel better by singing sweet traditional songs from other cultures, such as Очи чёрные (Dark Eyes) or Garota de Ipanema (The Girl from Ipanema).In conclusion, Counter Strike transformed me into a better father and a better person, in addition to making me more patient, tolerant to hateful people and more trained in languages and cultures.Better than any psychiatric therapy. 10/10

review: This game came as a bit of a surprise, since the first instalment of the series was a moderately successful title that left fans wanting more. Now, 13 entire years later, we get a sequel that turbo boosts the concept of the original in every way imaginable.You still play as Titus, but now you have a squad that follows you in every mission, and the main enemy for the first half of the game are Tyranids.Said Tyranids have some of the best dynamic swarm movement I've ever seen in a videogame thanks to the dev's experience with similar mechanics on games like World War Z.They can break off into clusters, pile on top of walls and generally act like a real horde, not a pre-scripted bot puppet.Graphically, the game is truly impressive, perhaps one of the best I've ever seen. I never tire of looking at the vast, grandiose cities going down in flames as battles rage on in the distance, with swarms of aliens descending from the skies while battleships fire at them. The design of the marines and maps is also spot-on, Warhammer fans (myself included) will rejoice at the small details on every character and building model. Of course, such heavy graphical fidelity comes at the price of performance, and the game does need a beast of a PC to run: with an RTX4070 ti, I could only manage 60-90 FPS at 1440p with everything maxed, with dips below 60 in extremely messy scenes. Still, DLSS did its job (I'm sure that without it, performance would be even worse) and the game hasn't crashed in over 12 hours of play so far.Sound design is also good, with special mention going to the weapon effects: one can only describe them as...meaty.Now, to the main point: the gameplay is limited, but enjoyable. What I mean by this is that you won't get any complex plots, open maps and huge skill trees here: story mode is almost completely linear, point A to point B, kill enemies, cutscene, repeat. You have some loadout options, but overall it's really not worth playing more than once.However, it is very fun, and it doesn't overstay its welcome at an average duration of 8-10 hours (side missions excluded).The melee combat didn't click much for me personally, with an awkward parry system and combos that can be performed with only one button. The ranged, third-person shooting is very satisfying though.After you're done with the story, you have two main modes to discover: the side missions that are heavily coop-focused and have their own class and progression system, and the PvP multiplayer.Said missions are much more challenging than the main story and require you to use your combined abilities and weapons to succeed, while offering weapon leveling, special abilities, small skill trees and marine customization options.The PvP is serviceable, offering the usual modes ones would expect (capture point, team death match etc.) while including a modified version of the skill trees used in the other mode. It runs much better performance-wise (120 FPS) and it feels alright, not exactly an afterthought but certainly not the mode the devs have put the most work on. For example, they could have added extra features like vehicles, turrets, abilities unique to each faction or even the ability to control Tyranids ala Left 4 Dead to make it more exciting.Most of the criticism I can throw at this game is simply my wish for more of it: more missions, more weapons, more classes and definitely more factions. Happily, the devs have promised exactly that with the roadmap: we'll get further updates along the way, for free (with a paid cosmetic option) and a very likely expansion in the future, as the ending of the main story hints at more adventures.Given the commercial success of the title, I'm sure we'll get all of that and more.For the Emperor!

review: Regrettably i am leaving a negative review pointing out the serious shortcomings of Space Marine 2 as a veteran Vermintide/Darktide player who loves 40k lore.- During the first launch of the game, Epic games online components are installed automatically without a prompt screen. I do not want it in my computer. You have to go through loops to uninstall it. There is a reason why i am using steam and steam only and i want the developers to respect it. - When compared with Darktide, Dawn of War series and especially Mechanicus, Space Marine 2 has the weakest music OST. Looks like it was not even at top ten of the priority list during development.- As a cheap attempt, the game is trying to draw more attention by Twitch drops.- Very terrible companion ai. One of the worst i have seen for years. They do not use their ranged weapons in most cases and run gret distances to melee an enemy regarless of the class. And they very rarely execute a stunned elite enemy who is only two feet away from them. Such a shame. - No FOV slider.- Holding buttons to activate the abilities, instead of hitting them, is a terrible design choice.- Throwing a frag grenade takes two seconds, activating cloak takes another 2.5 seconds. Character gets hit during uncancellable animations. Every movement and ability use feels unresponsive and stiff during the campaign and multiplayer. Runningg gets interrupted for no reason even if you are holding shift and not even hit by anything. - Uncancellable dodge, roll over and similar animations are the primary reason why i keep dying. Controls feel very unresponsive.- Boss fights are almost identical. Area attacks such as some form of 3 round mortar shots, melee charge attacks, ranged attacks and one big 3-wave either green or purple wide area attack which can hit even behind cover is the same rinse and repeat mechanic for both tyranid and chaos bosses. - Melee combat is terribly designed. Interruptions are common and costs the player half of his health points.- Ranged weapons feel weak. An elite enemy (Not a boss or a lecter) takes 30 to 40 bolter rounds to put down. Crossing bone swords makes the enemy immune to ranged damage even if you hit the legs, head or spray it from sides. - The enemies i have mentioned above are bullet sponges but a hit from them take out half of your hp. - Crowd control options are limited to grenades. I suggest developers to play Vermintide and Dark Tide to see how it is perfected during many years. - There is a hideous terrible jetpack mission. I hated it.- Multiple 'Loading resources - loading logic' screens. - Entire multiplayer lobby system has to be redesigned. It is bad.- You cannot inject your allies with the stimpack you have in your inventory. - PVP section of the game is the worst. Very unbalanced. Is this game not beta-tested?- Cheaters are out there already. I have already witnessed speedhacks and maphacks.- Easy Anticheat is known as how 'Easy' it is to bypass it. A bad choice from the developers.- The number of the co-op missions is very few. These missions in general feel rushed, unfinished and exteremely repetitive with very little variation. Even the spawn locations are more or less the same.- Unlocking armor pieces or better versions of the same weapon is very grindy. This is how the game targets longevity.- The game becomes boring and repetitive very quickly. I do not expect it to have a long lifespan. - I was unable to pickup some medkits, ammo boxes or grenades even i had the inventory slot available. Pickup prompt was not there.- Ranged enemies shoot with 120% accuracy and every shot lands perfectly. - There is a shield or armor mechanic which recharges a specific amount with combo kills. This mechanic is not working as intended and definitely not user friendly.Cnclusion: 6/10. Wait for a discount or buy the cheapest package if you must. After the hype is dead, the game will no longer be played by most of us. I believe that Space Marine 2 would be a great game if it was released 10 years ago.

It also looks fantastic and runs surprisingly well (7800x3d + 3080 ti, getting 70-90 fps with RT off and everything on Very High).Very strong recommend out the gate. I have to stop playing and go to bed but I want more badly.edit: Played it a bit more at lunch and still enjoying it. The first boss f-ed me up a few times but overall this is easier than a FromSoft game. I also am really enjoying the quick spells / form changes, seems to add a nice diversity to the combat and strategy.

review: Black Myth Wukong is an absolute masterclass of a game. All the hype, all the praise, all the positive buzz surrounding this game...they're absolutely deserved and this is hands down, one of THE best games of this generation, not just this year. The combat, fluidity of animations, the level and boss design, the intricate level and environmental design, all the different characters and enemies, they're all very unique, varied and superbly crafted. When you take control of the Monkey King (Sun Wukong) you really feel the power behind that staff and every swing you make against your enemies. I won't spoil the details but the gameplay mechanic is very rich and varied and rewarding. There's a whole level up system that can be used to power up your abilities and spells which can be used in subsequent battles. This btw is not necessarily a souls-like game even though some mechanics are present there but the combat style is very fast and responsive. I'm only just scratching the surface of the game and trust me when I say, this is one of the best action RPG games I've ever played in a good while and easily among to very best the game industry has to offer. Easily a 10/10 for me. Well done Game Science for creating such a well-crafted masterpiece. You deserve all the success and praise.

review: 2022 Masterpiece of a game! PROS:-The story is masterfully told (not always through dialogue) and is FULL of lore. (Try looking at your surroundings and the scenery)-Open world is HUGE and convincing (And BEAUTIFUL!)-The Atmosphere is (with all fromsoft games) absolutely incredible-Exploration feels organic. When you find something cool, it actually feels like you discovered it. You aren't "hand-held" and guided to an objective by a quest marker on a minimap-The mechanics are well polished and varied-Weapons are plentiful and highly customizable-Ashes of war expand upon the weapon customization and are IMO the best addition to this game.-Invasions by other players are fair - giving the host an advantage (*Controversial opinion*)-Compatible with Steam cloud saves - A welcome change from DS3-You can jump! (I know, right?!)-I could go on...CONS:-FPS locked at 60-Made for controllers - mouse and keyboard can be bit awkward-Performance can be a bit stuttery at times, especially in large, open areas-Multiplayer is not the best:--Connection issues are common (Peer-to-peer sucks)--Severely limits mobility and restricts you to the specific area where summon takes place (Intended feature - Not necessarily a CON)YES, it's a hard game... NO, it shouldn't have an "easy mode"*** If you are having a hard time or getting one-shot by mobs/bosses... GO ELSEWHERE; maybe level up a bit. (Also, try putting points into vigor... How hard is that to figure out?) Vigor = life. This isn't dark souls. (As much as it feels like it is.) There is no need to bash your head against a brick wall (a.k.a. a boss) over and over again.GITTING GUD not required, but it IS HIGHLY advised...

review: 2023 Total war is my favorite strategy game series, paradox aside.I did not expect this game to have a great launch, based off of my perception of Rome 2, Britannia, Attila, 3 King launches.I bought this game right at 20% off within a month of launch solely for the 5-6 people multiplayer campaign which is a fantastic feature that I absolutely love, and have sunk loads of hours with my friends into it. Thou I imagine we are a minority that use this feature.That being said, my interest (and my friends) has stalled out. And I have not touched it since. (pretty sure my friends stopped playing too). My consensuses is similar to how I view Warhammer 1, Attila.The bugs, unrefined mechanics, and lackluster game play does not allow continuous fun from what the game has to offer. It is currently still a worse version of Warhammer 2.The only reason I currently return I for a occasional multiplayer campaignI expect CA to pour their souls into this game but until I no longer get the feeling that I rather play Warhammer 2, I won't recommend this game.I don't expect CA to change this thou, the Warhammer 3 "realms of chaos" campaign sucks (No joke, I'd rather play "wraith of Sparta" campaign)...If they update the (Warhammer 2 campaign) eye of the vortex, ill forgive them.Update: So it does seem like CA is putting effort into the game and I've been enjoying it . Made the immortal empires campaign free, redid a bad DLC, putting updates into the game, putting vitality into the base content, fixing bugs, yet somehow sieges, still just are awful (like at least revert to WH2). I can say this game is good now.

review: This is a FOMO game. (Fear of Missing Out).The game is great to play only once you can try it as it's free if you don't have something to play but don't invest in it.The mechanics of the game are made in a way, so you must always play every week and every day, you have to at least log in every day, check the base, sell stuff, and so on.I played the game for 208 hours and played the whole season and after this season I was expecting as promised by the developers of the game to start a new season with some of the materials/weapons/armor/deviations that I had gathered during my playthrough but this is NOT happening because you only have to spend a few points to transfer some of the items between seasons.Only a weapon costs so many points that you can't transfer anything else just a pair of pants together with my weapon and that's it, all the thousands of materials that I gathered after playing for 208 hours are useless as you can't bring them over.The current season is a replay from the previous one with no changes at all neither the map has changed neither new mechanics or new quests, and still you have to start again from level 2 with the pajamas that you started when you started first playing the game...Some bugs that were from the beta when I first played the game are still there not fixed and from what I believe they never are going to be fixed because they don't break the game just make it harder for you. For example, you gather polluted water to pass it through a purifier to make impure acid, while you are online it works perfectly when you are offline the same machine gives you purified water instead of impure acid this bug was from when the game was beta and it's still here.I do have a lot of things that I can keep going on but the message is clear, it's a free game play it as free don't invest time or money on it.They could keep the seasons longer so they can have to release new content and then make everyone reroll their characters but instead, they choose to make everyone start from level 2 in the same content.Personally, I can't recommend this game to anyone because it's a FOMO game and the way that the developers are working toward the players is actually to keep them with the same stuff that has already been made instead of making new content for it.

review: Before I decided to get the game, which I didn't buy it myself. A steam friend gave me this game as gift out of the blue, thanks to him much appreciated. To be frank, I was expecting this game to be your regular souls like with a Chinese theme and ok combat. Well, I was wrong. I was blown away by the game.For one, the introduction story and chapter cut scenes were all topnotch, as if the developers hired all the participants from short stories award winners to make them. Music gives me goose bumps, never had I listen to a sound track so culturally Chinese and yet so grand and epic. As an ethnic Chinese, I never played a game that is so authentically Chinese, whether it is the aesthetics, music. buildings and clothing of the characters. You really cannot compare games with the art designs for Wo Long with Wukong. Though both uses Chinese culture as their setting the game. Wo Long just looks a little too foreign/off to a Chinese to me. (Like Ninja turtles to Japanese) While the level design of the game is not too different from your regular linear ARPG. The combat is just too good. Despite using mainly a staff for the MC weapon, there are three stances the player can switch from. Each stance has their strength and weakness depending on the enemy you are fighting. It is encouraged to switch stance against different bosses, it will make the fight better. Then there are spells and Spirits aka yao guai to help customize your build based on your fighting style. Combat is great! But do take notes, while some bosses may be too easy to a souls veteran, there are many others, especially hidden secret bosses that will give souls like veteran a run for their money. Map for each chapter is surprisingly huge. Given Chapter one is shorter. Everything because really huge starting from Chapter two.This is a really great game. If this game doesn't get a game award. the game award is rigged for sure.

review: 2022 I recommend this game if and only if you are already a fan of FromSoft souls games. A lot of people come into this game thinking it's a GRRM version of Skyrim or Breath of the Wild. It is not. It's a Fromsoft game, which means: 1: Direction: There is very little to tell you where to go, and when to go there. This game has some direction (which is more than previous games due to the open world) BUT this direction is not a direct line you should necessarily take. The game is big and the direction on the map is your eventual destination not your immediate goal. Exploration is rewarded. 2: Story: There is very little in the way of exposition in Fromsoft games. Every item description, every scrap of dialog, the position of ruins on the map all tell the story for those who care to search. However the story of the world is not hand fed to you. 3: Difficulty: This isn't the easiest Fromsoft game and Fromsoft is known for “difficult games”. You will die a lot, and that’s okay. While there is no menu option for difficulty in game, Fromsoft games are known for having builds that can trivialize the game. If you want an easy mode find the weapons/spells that make the game easy. Right now free Kamehameha Wave is crazy good (look up SpiffingBrit on YouTube)Current major issue I am aware of:There is a bug that can cause significant frame drops regardless of the specs of your PC. This does not affect everyone. 2 of my roommates and I have Identical specs. 1 gets frame rate drops the other roommate and I do not. As far as I can tell there is no way to know if you will have the issue until you get the issue. Don't people who are upset about this. Not being able to play the game is a valid reason to be upset. In conclusion: If you have never played a Souls game, see if you can get one of the Dark Souls games on sale and try it first. If you already don't like Souls games don't bother buying it, you wont like it. I don't buy racing games because I don't like them and that is fine. It's okay if you don't like Fromsoft ARPGs, don't let anyone tell you differently.

review: After 250 hours on August 2nd, 2024My only review change is a thumbs up because they're constantly trying to fix stuff. But how I review this game is:While the game is fun, they really make the easiest things the most difficult. --After putting in 124 hours. As of July 22, 2024Once Human has the potential to be a great game. It's currently plagued by numerous issues that need urgent attention.Bugs Galore After Patch: Initially, the game seemed promising, but post-patch, it's been riddled with bugs. These bugs range from minor inconveniences to game-breaking issues that severely impact the overall experience.Missing Housing and Territory Movement: The game has significant features missing, such as the ability to access housing or move territories. It's been a week since these issues surfaced, and there has been no communication or updates from the developers, leaving players in limbo.Lag Issues: The game suffers from persistent lag issues. Whether it's during peak times or off-peak hours, the performance is consistently hindered by lag, making the gameplay frustrating and often unplayable.Server Problems: The server is always full, yet it feels dead. This paradox is frustrating as there's either a lack of players or they're dispersed in a way that makes the game world feel empty. Additionally, fixing one server issue often leads to another, creating a never-ending cycle of problems.Tedious Reward System: The reward system is overly complicated, requiring multiple clicks to claim rewards. Navigating through four menus to claim a single reward, then repeating the process for others, is unnecessarily time-consuming and tedious.Lack of Clear Instructions: The game lacks clear descriptions and instructions for players, particularly for complex features like Prime Wars. Understanding that Prime Wars is cross-world or connected-worlds and not tied to one specific world within the server is crucial, yet this information is poorly conveyed.Poor Housing Mechanics: The housing mechanics, especially snapping, are horrid. Building roofs or house walls is a struggle as the snapping feature barely works as intended, making construction a frustrating task.Blueprint system requires some rework - where gold/legendary gear is only available to the Wish Machine. And the only currency is locked behind weekly tasks - with limited availabilityWhile the game is fun. It definitely needs some polishing

review: 评分：9.5/10首先声明，我手比较笨，接触类似的游戏也比较少，所以现在刚刚进入第二章。仅就目前的体验给予评价。优点：1、游戏性，作为传统动作RPG，游戏基本满足了我对类似游戏的期望——通过战斗积累经验以及相关资源，并以此提高自身能力从而挑战更高难度。技能看起来很多，或许会有不平衡的地方，但作为一款单机游戏，其影响不会太大。2、画面，非常优秀，没开光追和DLSS也能感受到整体画面的瑰丽，特别是以写实风格展现出的逼真的中国山水。开篇天庭的战斗场面里云雾缭绕的氛围也是十分出色。3、音乐，超出预期，无论是几次预告中所展现的音乐，还是第二章开篇之前没听过的秦腔，都展现了深厚的音乐创作能力——无论填词还是谱曲都满足了我对游戏内容的想象。可以说对一款不以音乐为卖点的游戏，实在是超出了我的预期。缺点：1、闪避判定似乎过于严苛了，又或者在进攻的过程中无法中断进攻进行闪避，这导致我感受到的游戏难度超出预期。总结：《黑神话：悟空》在游戏性没有特别出彩的情况下，实则在其他方面展现出了惊人的能力，着实将这款游戏变成了一部可以并且需要全方位欣赏的作品，整体品质令人惊叹。——————————————————————————Rating: 9.5/10First, I should clarify that I'm not very skilled with my hands, and I haven't played many games of this genre, so I've only just reached the second chapter. This review is based on my current experience.Pros:1. Gameplay: As a traditional action RPG, the game basically meets my expectations for this type of game—gaining experience and resources through combat to improve abilities and face more challenging difficulties. The skills seem plentiful, and while there may be some balance issues, since this is a single-player game, it shouldn't have too much of an impact.2. Graphics: Very impressive. Even without ray tracing and DLSS, the overall visual beauty is stunning, especially the realistic depiction of Chinese landscapes. The atmosphere in the opening battle in the Heavenly Court, with its swirling mists, is also exceptionally well done.3. Music: Exceeded my expectations. Whether it's the music showcased in the trailers or the Qin opera in the opening of the second chapter that I hadn't heard before, the music demonstrates strong compositional skills—both the lyrics and the score align with my imagination of the game's content. For a game that doesn't primarily focus on music, it truly surpassed my expectations.Cons:Dodge Mechanism: The dodge timing seems overly strict, or perhaps it's the inability to interrupt an attack to dodge that makes the game feel more difficult than expected.Summary:While <<Black Myth: Wukong>> doesn't particularly stand out in gameplay, it excels in other areas, turning the game into a piece of art that can and should be appreciated from all angles. The overall quality is truly remarkable.

review: The majority of negative reviews in a nutshell:1: I didn't coordinate with my friends on which server we were going to play on so I am now mad at the world that we cant play together and I have to start over on a new server and I lose my progress.2: The typical TOS misunderstanding that these cyber security expert wannabes flail around recklessly without actually understanding what the TOS means. TLDR, the game is backed by GDPR guidelines and if it was breaking them it wouldn't be sold in the US.3: Queue times for servers. The game just released, every new mmo/server hosted game has queues on release, get over it.My review:SO FAR, this game has delivered on every single aspect of survival/mmo/looter shooter that I have wanted in a game, albeit sometimes it can be a buggy experience, or it can lead to weird interactions with NPCs (really needs work). It has been an incredible experience and I will continue to support this game until it either puts P2W features in, or somehow the experience is sour after the wipe. Either way, I love this game so far and recommend it to anyone who likes the division, rust, palworld, scp, death stranding, or control, as it has small aspects of all of those games all jam packed into one awesome and intense package. AND YES, its still fun even solo.Great work Starry Studio.

review: 2023 Decided to take the plunge despite bouncing off Dark Souls and the like and hearing how hard Elden Ring was. Well, don't let that put you off. It wasn't a cakewalk, but just doing everything in the game without grinding levelled me sufficiently that nothing caused me too much trouble. 140 hours I think I saw everything (no appetite for New Game+), I'm sure I never actually "got good", but I did at least learn a little patience instead of button mashing constantly.The game was very good, but I won't go so far as to say it's personal GOTY material, nor one of the best open world games I've played. review: - Story:Black Myth Wukong is a game inspired by the classic Chinese novel Journey to the West. The story revolves around Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, as he embarks on an epic journey filled with mystical creatures, ancient deities, and mythical lore. The narrative stays true to the source material while introducing new elements and characters, offering a fresh yet familiar experience. The story is deeply engaging, with a blend of traditional mythology and dark fantasy that adds depth and intrigue to the gameplay.- Gameplay:The gameplay in Black Myth Wukong is a mix of action RPG elements with Souls-like combat mechanics. Players can expect challenging encounters, precise combat, and a variety of abilities that Wukong can use, such as shape-shifting, wielding different weapons, and utilizing magical powers. The game encourages exploration, strategic combat, and mastering the different forms and abilities of Wukong. The gameplay is fluid and responsive, with a steep learning curve that rewards skill and patience.- Graphics & Visuals:Black Myth Wukong is a visual masterpiece, utilizing Unreal Engine 5 to deliver stunningly detailed environments, realistic character models, and impressive lighting effects. The game’s art direction is heavily influenced by Chinese mythology, with intricate designs that bring the mythical world to life. The attention to detail in the textures, animations, and overall visual fidelity makes it one of the most graphically impressive games of its time.- Audio & Music:The audio design in Black Myth Wukong is top-notch, with immersive sound effects that enhance the gameplay experience. The music is heavily inspired by traditional Chinese compositions, blending orchestral elements with traditional instruments to create a haunting and atmospheric soundtrack. The voice acting is equally impressive, with performances that capture the essence of each character, especially Wukong himself.- Levels & Stages:The levels in Black Myth Wukong are meticulously designed, offering a mix of open-world exploration and linear paths. Each level is filled with secrets, hidden paths, and challenging enemies, encouraging players to explore every nook and cranny. The game’s stages are diverse, ranging from lush forests and ancient temples to dark caves and otherworldly realms. The level design emphasizes verticality and environmental interaction, allowing players to use Wukong’s abilities creatively to navigate the world.- Bosses:Boss fights are a highlight of Black Myth Wukong. Each boss is a formidable opponent with unique attack patterns, requiring players to learn and adapt to their moves. The boss designs are imaginative and intimidating, often drawing from Chinese folklore and mythology. These encounters are challenging, requiring a mix of strategy, timing, and skill to overcome.- Environments:The environments in Black Myth Wukong are richly detailed and diverse, reflecting the game’s mythical and dark fantasy themes. From serene natural landscapes to eerie, otherworldly realms, each environment is distinct and memorable. The world feels alive, with dynamic weather systems, day-night cycles, and interactive elements that add to the immersion.- User Interface:The user interface in Black Myth Wukong is clean and intuitive, providing all the necessary information without cluttering the screen. The UI design complements the game’s aesthetic, with menus and HUD elements that are easy to navigate. The interface allows players to manage their inventory, abilities, and quests efficiently, ensuring a smooth gameplay experience.- Objectives and Quests:Objectives and quests in Black Myth Wukong are well-integrated into the narrative, with a mix of main story missions and side quests that offer additional lore and rewards. The quests are varied, ranging from combat-focused challenges to exploration and puzzle-solving. The objectives are clear, but the game encourages players to explore and discover hidden content on their own.- NPCs:NPCs in Black Myth Wukong are well-crafted and add depth to the world. They range from friendly allies who provide guidance and lore to enigmatic figures that enhance the game’s mysterious atmosphere. The interactions with NPCs are meaningful, often revealing more about the game’s story and Wukong’s journey.- Game Physics:The game physics in Black Myth Wukong are impressive, with realistic interactions between characters, environments, and objects. Wukong’s abilities, such as shape-shifting and wielding different weapons, are fluid and responsive, making combat and exploration feel natural. The physics also play a role in environmental puzzles and combat strategies, adding an extra layer of depth to the gameplay.- Progression System:The progression system in Black Myth Wukong is robust, allowing players to customize Wukong’s abilities and stats to suit their playstyle. As players progress, they can unlock new forms, abilities, and weapons, each offering unique advantages in combat. The progression is tied to exploration and combat, rewarding players for taking on challenges and discovering secrets.- AI:The AI in Black Myth Wukong is challenging and intelligent, with enemies that adapt to the player’s tactics. The AI-controlled opponents use a variety of strategies, from coordinated group attacks to exploiting the environment. Bosses, in particular, have complex AI patterns that require players to think critically and adapt their approach.- Gameplay Analysis:Black Myth Wukong offers a deep and rewarding gameplay experience, combining challenging combat, exploration, and a rich narrative. The game’s difficulty is on the higher side, reminiscent of Souls-like games, but it is balanced by responsive controls and a fair learning curve. The variety in Wukong’s abilities and the diverse environments keep the gameplay fresh and engaging throughout.- Game Difficulty:The game’s difficulty is challenging but fair, with a focus on skillful combat and strategic thinking. Players who enjoy difficult games like Dark Souls or Sekiro will find Black Myth Wukong to be a satisfying experience. The game demands patience, timing, and mastery of Wukong’s abilities, but it also rewards perseverance with a sense of accomplishment after overcoming tough challenges.- Final Thoughts:Black Myth Wukong is a stunning achievement in modern gaming, blending traditional Chinese mythology with cutting-edge technology to create an unforgettable experience. The game’s challenging combat, deep narrative, and breathtaking visuals make it a must-play for fans of action RPGs and mythology-inspired games.- Positives:Stunning graphics and visual design.Deep, engaging story inspired by Chinese mythology.Challenging and rewarding combat system.Varied and immersive environments.Robust progression system with diverse abilities.- Negatives:Weapon crafting within the crafting tree is limited to use one type at a time. If you wish to craft a different weapon or revisit a previously crafted item from the same tree, the most recent crafting record will be reset.Overall, Black Myth Wukong is a highly polished and ambitious game that excels in almost every aspect. Its blend of traditional storytelling, challenging gameplay, and state-of-the-art graphics make it one of the standout titles of its generation. While its difficulty may not be for everyone.

review: 2023 I really want to like this game as I liked Total War Warhammer 2, but in the current state it is simply not enjoyable. There are plenty of things that bother me like e.g. the excessive bloom on some textures, the way-to-strong depth of field and blur, the stutter and performance issues on some battlemaps and after end turns, and lackluster sieges (the list goes on and on). My main gripes are with the completely annoying, overly player-focussed, incompetent, and predictable AI and the enormous amount of bugs (among the most egregious are not-spawing-Ariel and the absence of Kroxigors for Nakai).Where Warhammer 2 was fun and polished, TWW3 is simply messy and non-functional. It breaks my heart to see the game that should be TWW2, but bigger and better, in such a miserable state.I suspect (hope) the devs are trying their best but probably as it is often the case upper management puts profits from new content over a functioning product. This is how we get a overprized 25$ DLC when the base game is in such an atrocious state.I didn't buy the Chaos Dwarfs and will continue to not buy anything from CA until they deliver an actually functioning product (which I paid for). Although I fear this might never happen...

review: It's nice for a few hours. But it's a game with no genius. The art direction is great, and the gameplay is brutal. But it's as repetitive as you could wish for, the game sequences follow each other and repeat themselves, and there's no originality in the design of the levels or in the sequences on offer. While it's visually stunning, technically it's very limited, with no interaction with the scenery other than the same old canisters to be exploded every ten metres. The general ergonomics are catastrophic, not at all intuitive, with repeated loading times. At 30 euros for ten hours of fun, why not? At 60 euros, no way.

review: 2023 I've been a long-time Total War fan for over a decade, but the Warhammer trilogy is what truly got me invested in the franchise. I've bought every single DLC for TWWH series since the first game released in 2016. However, the latest price hike and CA's so-called justification for their decision have left nothing but sour taste in my mouth. I would understand the price hike if the DLC contained more content, or if CA was actually increasing pay for its employees, but neither is the case. They are evidently trying to recoup losses incurred by poor financial decision made by their executives. That burden should not fall on the fans. This game still CAN be something special - fans WILL buy contents for this game years to come if CA puts effort into them. But lack of bug fixes, consistent communication, and justifiable pricing will be the downfall of the community if they persist. To the average CA employee: I still support you and all the hard work you've put into the franchise. I hope the CA execs realize they're fumbling the golden egg they're sitting on.

review: The Story is honestly really fun and probably the best part about the game currently. It has Co-op for 2 more players and is overall written well and feels good to play. Even playing alone is fun because the squad AI is surprisingly good.Combat feels really good if not a little clunky at times. You feel powerful in the campaign and in PvE on recommended difficulties. Combat in PvP is a mixed bag due to class counters and some imbalance. PvE classes are unique and very flexible in terms of skills and is very fun with friends and even randoms. Right now you can only play Loyalist PvE which is somewhat disappointing since they have the Chaos models and voice lines in PvP.PvP needs some serious balancing since right now it feels like you either get stomped or you do the stomping with no in between.Customization is fun as long as you are a loyalist Space Marine even though it could use a few more chapter emblems (please give me Son's of the Phoenix emblems I am begging you). Chaos needs its own major update for cosmetics because right now its just color swaps. Only major deal breaker is that the servers these guys use to host online games are the literally the worst. Ping right now will always be high no matter how good your WiFi is and its not rare to drop from a game. The Season Pass also does not work/isn't what you think it is. You don't seem to unlock anything right now besides one skin that isn't editable for the Heavy Class in PvE.Once everything is fixed with more content added: 9/10Right now Overall: 7/10 due to server issues for multiplayer PvE: 7/10 has major potential but needs better servers and more contentPvP: 8/10 if you either have friends or are really good otherwise its closer to a 6/10 due to imbalance Story alone: 9/10

review: This game is bad. It feels like it's gamedesign decisions are 10 to 15 years old.Let me explain why:1.There are two weapons. The first ranged one, and the second one. WTF?EVERY OTHER GAME has weapons you can switch to. Parry with rightcklick, attack with leftclick and aim with rightclick. Switch between melee and ranged weapons and this works well. But you cant in this game for some reason.2. Hold keys to interact instead pressing them. Why? I am not mentally disabled, the very few occasions you interact with something you literally cant f that up. Why waste my time for no reason?3.Unskipable intros. Watch stuff you dont care for 1 minute everytime you start the game. WHY DO YOU KEEP INSITING IN WASTING MY TIME?4.No FOV. Come on. In 2024? I cant see anything. There's a big spacemarine in 40% of my face and I have a fov that feels like 80° at best.5. Epic Store Services need to run in the backround. I never signed up for this. This isnt mentioned in the store afaik. This is no biggy, but after serving me this pile of crap im gonna sht on every small thing I'm gonna find, why wouldnt I.I stopped playing the game before discovering more bs game design decision and I'm gonna refund this.Who knows what else they f'ed up, but I'm not gonna deal with this.

review: It's rare that a game lives up to the hype these days, but Black Myth WuKong does just that. It was promised as a visual spectacle with amazing combat and boss fights and it is certainly that. While I at times get frustrated and want to quit, like I did shortly before writing this, I also feel an immense satisfaction after beating a tough enemy. Game is pretty linear as well which I like, a lot of games are TOO open these days but this one is lazer focused on action scenes. Decent customisation, mechanics and some cool build possibilities, it's a genuinely great game. The ONLY big issue I have is the lack of difficulty slider and the lack of a mini map. Look it's 2024, if you wanna be a pro Elden Ring player that's cool, but some of us just want some cool fighting combat and to beat up enemies. Not everything needs to be a GIT GOOD style game. And for people who DO want that, they can continue to play on the higher difficulties. Other than that, having a lot of fun and even though I need a break for now because of those damn archers killing me, I will be back.

review: 2023 I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, created my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

review: 缺点： BUG方面： 一、红孩儿Boss战二阶段，在所有浮空分身都砸下来后，红孩儿真身有几率会卡在半空不下来，导致战斗无法继续。二、有时候进入装备和物品栏界面会只出现空白背景，而无法正常显示现有的装备、物品。三、下筋斗云时，有一定概率不显示UI。四、和NPC石中人对话时，会拉到附近远程怪的仇恨，导致对话过程中一直被投射。 游戏设计方面： 一、 空气墙过多且很生硬。有些地方明明做出了“通路”，但实际不可通过。如果以树干或者石块堵路的柔性方式来暗示玩家此路不通，会让游戏体验更具沉浸性。二、 部分大体积Boss锁定点不合理，经常让玩家误判方向和距离，导致空大。 优点： 游戏设计方面： 一、 装备系统恰到好处，即不过度简单，也不过度复杂。每个装备的属性在对付特别Boss或者使用特别打法时都有妙用，并非一般游戏那样随着级别升高或者获取新装备后，旧的装备就会被丢弃或者雪藏。二、 技能在土地庙（传送点）处可以随时重置，能无代价更换新的打法，拓展游戏的可玩性，这点在多周目下尤其明显。三、 妖怪种类多种多样，而且每一类都有自己独特的外观和招式，并非简单的换皮怪。使得玩家在每一回跑图清怪都能有不同体验。 思想内涵方面： 一、 叙事。采用“罗生门”式碎片化叙事，这点如果读完在游戏内的影神图（角色背景故事集）会有更深的体会。二、 结局。个人认为无论“好”结局还是“坏”，一定程度上都超脱了一般游戏的爽文式结局，甚至具有一些哲理的开放性。这也是很多之前速通玩家对结局颇有怨怼的地方。 结论： 作为预购玩家，原本是抱着成与不成都支持一下国产第一款大作的态度。但目前游戏的成功可以说给了我一个大大的惊喜。虽然有bug，有团队经验不足导致地包括但不限于上述设计缺点，但瑕不掩瑜；作为一家新成立的小公司，游戏科学能做到如此地步，我觉得无法对这些瑕疵作过度苛刻的批评了。而在游戏发售后短时间内舆论场上风暴，本身也从话题度上证明了该游戏的成功。我无意介入这一阵阵风暴，作为一名玩家，我只想好好地待在平静的台风眼里，默默地玩游戏，时不时叹一声：“厉害！好玩！”这便够了。 CONS Bugs: I. In the second phase of the battle of Honghaier (Red Boy, one of Yaoguai kings), after all of clones crashing down, Honghaier may get stuck in the air and can’t land successfully. It directly results the battle being discontinued. There is no way to figure out except for reloading the battle.II. In some situations, equipment and item can’t be displayed normally, equipment and item tabs only show blank background.III. In some situations, UI may disappear after player dismounting Jindouyun (flying nimbus) .IV. One of nearby ranged monster always attacks you if interact with the NPC Shizhongren (Man-in-Stone, one of Characters) Game design: I. Invisible walls are overnumerous and unnatural. Some fake trails were just built for gorgeous background and not available for passing through. Please replace those ridiculous fake trails with rocks, trunks, fences or any environment matching things. These invisible walls is ruining our gameplay experience.II. Locking point of some bosses with huge body is illogical. It may mislead player and result ability or spells releasing on wrong position. PROS: Game design: I. Equipment system is on the perfection point, neither too simple and boring, nor too complicated and difficult. In common games, equipment item is more like ‘disposable item’, those equipment which gather previously will be destroy or just be stored on inventory. In contrast to that, each equipment with its special usage for the battle of special boss in this games. Meanwhile, different equipment/item combination will bring you different combat experience.II. Spark (Ability point) can be reset anytime in the nearest Tudimiao (Land Keeper’ shrine) at none of expense. It encourages players trying more methods to play this game, massively extends the gameplay, especially in second, third or even higher round.III. Category of yaoguai (monster) is varied. Every type of yaoguai with different model and action which can be easily distinguished from one to the other one. Designer didn’t put same mode on most of monster then paint them with different colour (nobody implies God of War hereby, doesn’t it?). It makes players always get fresh experience when they enter next chapter. Story I. The narration and text of this game belong to ‘rashomon-like’ style. Producers won’t tell players whole story directly. You need to gather NPC’s background information and carefully read them in Yingshentu (Portraits in journal tab) to find final truth behind endless lies, just like a detective chasing clues .II. About disputed ending, I personally consider whatever ‘good’ or ‘bad’ ending it is, the story won’t tell you what is it, it just enlightens you to think about what it should be. Philosophical karma, funny or serious? Can not judge it by a simple word. Conclusion: As a pre-purchase player, I have no idea of how good or bad for the first triple A video game which is base on Chinese classic folklore and ancient culture. I just throw money into slots and wait for uncertain result. Luckily, Game Science does an extreme nice job, bring me a huge surprise! Even with bugs and cons which I partly listed as above. Consider that how small their team size is, and moreover, Black myth: Wukong is their first triple A game, it’s unfair to blame them from head till toe. Don’t be a picky player all the time, be tolerant of these diligent game producers. After this game released, I noticed that some suspicious paparazzi posted their strange opinions everywhere. I think a pure game player should avoid those storms, stay away from publicity, grab a keyboard or controller then hit start button: Hell, it’s a game time!

review: 2023 Creative Assembly refuses to fix game breaking bugs for 6+ months, reneges on many many promises to fix under-performing areas of the game, and threatens to pull the plug on the game's "support" (lol what support?) if people don't accept their new 150% price hike for upcoming and future DLCs. I have more than 2000+ hour on TW:Warhammer series. I have played Total War since the days of TW: Rome. And I cannot on good conscious advocate buying the game at its current state and its current price. Don't get me wrong, the base game has a lot of potential to be good. With the current level of management, however, it's never getting there. I would never recommend buying this at full price--I would actually recommend boycotting buying anything from CA until they actually start caring about their product and its consumers--but if you really want to buy it, buy it on sale/steep discount.

review: Product received for free I have about 25 hours in this game currently since release date; been taking my time, exploring every nook and cranny (though the invisible walls are HELLA ANNOYING) and investing myself in all the lore with the enemy short stories and I'm only probably halfway done with Ch. 2.Been avoiding all spoilers and playing mostly blind as that's the best way to play in my opinion and given that I've been playing Demons Souls since '09 I'm familiar with the tricks with hidden bosses / secret areas and backtracking with an acquired item and figuring that stuff out so it's not too bad for me due to my experience with the genre.The game is more ARPG (Action Role-Playing Game) with shared elements of the Souls games and though some of the bosses I've encountered have frustrated me, I'm also having FUN, which says a lot and the feeling of finally defeating an enemy is extremely liberating and euphoric. You can tell this game was made with so much love and I can't recommend it enough, just give it a try!

review: Cons:Gameplay: Some perks be it class or weapon perks are overshadowed or useless Too much difference between the EXP rate of the lowest to the highest difficulty, which makes the leveling of single target weapons too tedious Kills give no exp and promote a "just rush past them" meta and mentality Enemies on higher difficulties have what feels like about 15% too much healthEngine: Bad Optimization No FoV slider The forced TAA is just uglyIncreasing the resolution on my 1080p screen to 4k via VSR and setting the FSR setting accordingly completely removes that issue but also removes at least 4 to at maximum 17 FPS, big oof.The best FPS + visual clarity balance setting is just the normal TAA or FSR at native max resolution of your screenOther: On launch the game automatically installs EOS, and asks you to agree to the EOS and EAC EULA, nothing of that is mentioned here on the store pagePros:Gameplay: Everything positive you've seen and heard is 100% true and feels even better when you actually do the fighting yourself. The classes even though they seem not that different actually have VERY different roles and become even more differentiated the further you progress in them. Really interesting progression system! The PvE and PvE progression is separate (Thank god)Engine: The Dynamic Resolution Scaling works quite good and enables lower end GPUs to play the game, albeit in blurry modeOther: You can uninstall EOS and EAC and play without it. The community so far is just a bliss, I love it!PvP I will not review or play the PvP mode and cannot comment on it.

The DLC can seem like theres too much to buy but you dont need any of it to enjoy the base game, and if you wait for a good sale you can grab most of them for around 50% off. review: 2023 Total War: Warhammer 3 is, for me, the most colossal failure of a sequel I have ever played. From the botched Launch to copious bugs, from poor design decisions to exorbitant pricing for new DLC, from poor optimization to scarce updates, I cannot justify recommending this. In lieu of broaching all of that, to offer a microcosm of the current state of the game, how about I post just the bugs that they acknowledge: • FPS drop on Cathay's Terrace farming/field maps. • Harald Hammerstorm can unlock "Indomitable" skill but is already Unbreakable. • When confederating Bretonnian factions, upkeep for questing Knights goes to 0 if Lord has Knights Vow. • Complications with Ariel spawning if you are beaten to rebirth by another Wood Elf faction. • Repanse is missing her unique mount model (Suleman). • Some of Harry the Hammer's abilities show placeholder text. • Snotling Pump Wagons do oversized damaged. • New Regiments of Renown units don't have unit caps. • Nakai can't recruit Kroxigors and other units. • Damsel's progression for vows is not advancing as intended. • Von Carstein Blade not being rewarded to caravans finishing at Castle Drakenhof. • Bloated corpses exploding randomly at the start of battles. • Free Company no longer appear to have their weapons in combat. • Crone Hellebron Death Night missions not triggering. • In Domination battles, units with both Frenzy and Unbreakable lose Frenzy when summoned as reinforcements. • Heroes can get stuck in an attacking army and cannot move. • When defending, Zharr-Naggrund wall towers are not controllable and do not fire. • Gatehouses on Zharr-Naggrund can be attacked, leading to units being crushed. • Ungrim’s ability “Journey’s End” not working. • Ranged battle AI is sometimes passive. • Thorek Ironbrow appears distorted in battle. • Units on Zhufbar map appear to be floating. • Soft lock when using the Hellforge tutorial. • Skinning issues with Centigor units. • “Support Religious Errantry” not working for Bretonnians. • Various technology tree oversights. • Champions of Chaos cannot upgrade Daemons using Warband Upgrades. • Throgg is not immune to Kislev Winter and Yvresse Mist attrition. • Teal visual effect on Glade Captain's bow disappears when she is firing. • AI moves just outside of player range. • Ambush battles do not properly start with army full of stalk units as AI cannot attack them. • Sometimes ranged units begin running into melee after running out of ammo with Guard mode on. • Iron Daemon & Dreadquake Mortar manual fire orders ignored despite UI showing orders present. • Event Message "Army Receives Plague" has placeholder text. • Sea encounters can cause the game to crash. • Some trait and tech tags are incorrect/do not work. • The UI scale can't be adjusted below 120% on 4K screens. • Units (particularly flying and cavalry) getting stuck, calling back a group. • Cathay Fire Rain Rocket crew continue fighting after being dismembered/beheaded. • AI controlled Vlad von Carstein is too tough in battle. • All Chaos Dwarfs factions show player's manufactory upgrades in the UI. • AI controlled Dark Elf factions build too many Black Arks. • Continued reports of anti-player bias in campaign AI targeting. • Line of sight issues over some unit types and certain map features. • Hellcannon projectiles alter course towards end of firing arc causing misses. • Valkia slam attack causes grey texture at point of impact. • Some Norsca Monster Hunts not working correctly. • Chaos Dwarf Lords with Great Taurus Mounts are susceptible to falling off walls. • Opening some UI panels causing performance issues. • Various siege and settlement battle issues (e.g weak Settlement Garrisons, weak walls and gates, ladder deployment, awkward pathfinding). • N'kari's charge animation seems to trigger too early. • Various missing sync kills. • Grimgor 'Enemy Killed in Battle' event message has incorrect faction name. • Various units unaffected by red line skills. • Some uncommon/common magic items showing better stats than rare items. • Incorrect model for Skink Oracle showing in Character details. • Blood splatter flickering on the ground (if Blood Pack enabled). • Cylostra is sometimes blocked from attacking an enemy settlement or army. • Wrong Ogre Kingdoms contract mission is sometimes given when selecting a specific contract. • Destroying a Tower on High Elf - Lothern will create a breach in the wall, leaving floating decals. • Whispers of T'zarkan could be more frequent. • Units spawning under the map. • Unique traits introduced in Warhammer III require balancing. • Ku'gath has a rough start in Immortal Empires. • Borrowed armies from factions will loyalty sometimes rebel. • Threaten may cause the game to crash in multiplayer campaigns. • Orion's faction ability can make it easy to generate free armies. • Visual issues with portraits. • Some unit models have excessively bright bloom. • Ambushing an army in forced march and letting them walk of the map causes the opposing army to die. • Autoresolve values seems overly favourable towards the player in Immortal Empires. • Inconsistencies in passive abilities or traits descriptions. • Some characters get more skill points than there are skills to invest them in. • Eyestrain & sickness. • Visual issues with trees spawning on maps. • Changed game settings are not saved, if player is leaving the game without properly closing it. • Chasing routing units is somewhat ineffective. • Cults are not impactful in campaign gameplay. • Corruption effects border textures visual issues. • Intended plague effects can easily get overwritten by other plagues. • Multiplayer desyncs when the AI's turn ends if one player is still going through the end turn cycle.That doesn't include bugs, like Ariel not being recruitable, that are listed as 'fixed' but still aren't and bugs that they haven't even acknowledged despite being in-game since Launch. The list becomes unmanageable when trying to compile all of them. There are 276 bugs that the Community Bug Fix Mod alone covers; there are hundreds more that aren't covered. Calling it unacceptable seems like an understatement.I waited 18 months to post a review to give them time to rechart the course of the game. While I will still hold out some hope for the series, primarily because I have enjoyed them so much in the past, and that it fills a niche with no real competitors, it is clear that Creative Assembly has underfunded and underdeveloped the game, exploited the good will they garnered after Total War: Warhammer II, and will continue to do so. If you want to continue supporting them, that is your prerogative, but I can no longer gloss over the myriad failures with the game and company.

review: As a fan of the 40k universe and Table top game since early 2000 this was Literally everything I had hoped it would be. The campaign was EPIC on the scale that you always imagined it would be like if you were a part of the action while shuffling you carefully painted and assembled minis around your home made terrain peices.I don't know how to adequately express that the authenticy and care taken to make this game really represent in a well played out narrative the immensity of the lore, scale of the structures, Massiveness of the armies and forces, the unique technologies and everything that makes 40k a masterwork of world building, really shines through even just playing through campaign. The battles feel intense, the sound design is amazing, graphically it is stunning from character and creature models to terrain, vehicles, architecture, and setpeices. I entirely get it there are some graphical glitches now and again and if i had a gamplay gripe it would be that the combat is a little clunky especially melee (but honestly the marines are pretty clunky....), although the Satisfying feel of firing the bolters and other weapons really covered for a lot. I'm sure as I continue to grind levels on Operations I'll be more upset about some of the technicals...but just purely as a 40K Space Marine fan I couldn't have enjoyed the campaign much more than I did. PvP is challenging and fun the Level grind Is going to be my next goal I'm not that big of a PvP player so I'm less concerned about it but it would be neat if that ended up being a strong feature too. Highly recommended in general, Must have if you love the 40K Universe. I'm sorry I'm not nitpicking like I'm sure there's plenty of reviews doing. But This is by FAR the best 40k Game I've played and I've played a LOT since Dawn of War 1 in 2004....Considering the number of patches games normally need before they have a mediocrely servicable product I feel like the Release of SM2 was above average in how well it performs technically on opening day (well 4 days before I got the early release version) compared to other new releases I have purchased, which I don't do often SpaceMarine 2 was an exception and I regret nothing.For the Emporer. Purge the Heretics.(Feel free to check out My screenshots!!! I loved the photo mode in this game too XD)

review: 2023 If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:6 tablespoons unsalted butter1/2 cup white sugar1/2 cup brown sugar1/4 cup water1/4 teaspoon cinnamon1 pinch salt5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced1 pastry for double-crust pieDirections:Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: This review only reflects the view of a SOLO player, if you intend to play with friends or pug the content then this doesn't apply to you. To anyone like myself who enjoys MMO-like games but plays almost completely solo I'd say give this a miss. At first it was enjoyable with most dungeons and bosses soloable (sometimes difficult but not impossible). However at endgame there is no difference whether you enter a dungeon solo or in a group, and with players finding the meme builds to make endgame challenges relatively easy the devs have done the only thing their tiny brains can do which is to simply increase the difficulty of all endgame dungeons and bosses to stupid levels. After the most recent updates endgame (Pro mode) dungeon enemies are just bullet sponges and the monolith bosses have stupid amounts of health with rediculous amounts of adds spawning continuously, not to mention timers not just as dps checks but for the whole fight. Two of these are a requirement to complete the story so far this season, which I can't do solo. Despite the jank I enjoyed so much about this game (looting, levelling, building, crops, weapon/armour builds) but the devs lack of innovation and imagination have created a wall I can't climb without playing with others which I won't do. I will keep an eye on the game and its updates, maybe drop in from time to time but I won't be investing any real time or money until they do something about endgame story content difficulties.

review: 2022 The best game I've ever played, a masterpiece in every aspect: Gameplay: it's challenging, but it gives all the elements to overcome these challenges and make you feel proud of yourself, it's in fact very fulfilling. There are many approaches you can take to progress in the game and the immense amount of content it offers makes for a lot of combinations with different outcomes that makes every one of them new and refreshing. Art style: it could be simply "graphics", but I consider it an "art style" because of how everything is put in the right place to give a beautiful view of the world from every place and at any given time. At any moment you can stop, look in a direction and see what it looks like a beautiful painting in front of you, it will be almost always different thanks to the day and night cycle and the weather changes. Story/Lore: it's pretty cryptic and obscure, difficult to understand at first because it's very intricate and the storytelling isn't direct, in fact you will get little information from NPCs or cutscenes, you will mostly need to read items descriptions, basically let the world itself speak to connect the pieces and some of them will be left out anyway, that's why there is a lot of lore and speculations. Game progress: the open world setting gives you a lot of freedom on how you can progress through the game, almost nothing is directly given to you beside general tips on where you should go and what you should do so it's up to you to understand it. This can be stressful as much as the gameplay itself but getting used to it makes you appreciate the sense of bewilderment it gives and encourages exploration because that's always important. Side quests progress: I have inserted this paragraph separately because you will eventually ed up finishing the game but you will probabily miss a lot of content because side quests have the same obscurity as everything else but they are missable, and some of them even too much and that's the only criticism I have about the game, it still encourages replayability because in order to understand and experience everything you will probably need to do different runs anyway. Variety: the world is massive and varied, it's divided in different regions and all of them have their unique atmosphere with fitting enemies, looks and stories. There are many dungeons, the major ones are all beautiful, the minor ones can feel repetitive after some point but I enjoyed them anyway because most of them have some sort gimmick that gives a bit of variety. There are a lot of enemies too, some of them can be encountered both as bosses and as regular enemies later in the game, it can feel repetitive too but they don't give the impression to be some sort of "filler" because it's all fitting and the game is so massive that it doesn't matter anyway. Finally, there are a ton of ingredients, items, equipments and dozens of types of weapons with different movesets and styles. Longevity/Replayability: even without the replayability part, the game is immense and it can take easily 100+ hours to finish without even experiencing everything, that's why it has a good replayability, you can start a new game+ by keeping the progress of the first run and experience the content you missed while still trying new things like different builds and approaches, there are also different endings that requires you to partake into different side quests.ConclusionsAs I said, this is the best game I've ever played and after almost 400 hours I still enjoy creating new characters and playing it in different ways, I even discover new dungeons and items after all this time! A masterpiece.

review: The game is a solid 10/10 for me, personally, otherwise I wouldn't have finished it 5 times and done all the achievements. There isn't anything in the game that I haven't enjoyed. Graphics, story, combat, the Chinese setting, everything clicked with me and I had real fun every singular minute spent in the game. The only thing the game could have improved is letting players enjoy all the equipment earlier in the game and the fact that there is no enough resources to upgrade everything you want in a single playthrough is a little bit frustrating. You get so many cool things so late in the game, you simply do not have enough time playing with them. I guess they had more chapters planned but they couldn't implement everything they had in mind.

review: 2022 This game is really fun, I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who is a fan of the franchise or is curious. The reviews are mixed, and most of that issue seems to come from people saying their game is constantly stuttering and having issues. While I haven't noticed any issues of that sort, it is possible to lower your graphics in the settings and this would likely help with the issue. The game's pop in and strange shadows make me feel as if the game is lacking some slight polish, however I believe that it's not much of an issue at all and that this kind of stuff is to be expected from such a large game.I feel like the game, while fun and effective in keeping ones attention, may have issues in keeping players engrossed if they enjoy running off the beaten path, as many of the encounters are difficult to either encourage the player to come back later, or to nudge them in the right direction. In one situation I opened a chest that transported me into a poisonous swamp with seemingly no way out (fast travel is always an option so long as you aren't in danger, and I didn't realize this until after enduring large amounts of stress)Many of the enemies one will encounter are difficult of foot, and a horseback approach may help to easily defeat them, that being said make sure to use all of your materials to their potential, as crafting can be extremely helpful in taking down strong foes. Thank you, and if you agree with any of my points, or will consider purchasing the game due to my points, please leave a helpful rating.

review: 2018 This is an extremely hardcore, skill-based first-person shooter, and it forces you to think differently than other modern shooters. If you’re a Call of Duty player, you’re going to need to change your play style to succeed here.Global Offensive is definitely a Counter-Strike sequel -- it looks and feels familiar, with minor tweaks here and there to help balance old issues and surprise longtime players. This is a demanding, skill-based multiplayer game that's as satisfying now as it ever was, but it's for a specific kind of player. If you're not willing to learn to play different than you're used to, look elsewhere. Otherwise, this is a top-tier tactics game that will probably share the long-tailed legacy of its predecessors....

review: An Epic journey that you will never forget.Disclaimer: I’m still making my way through the game, but after playing a few chapters, it’s clear that this game is something special.Premise: The game reminds me a lot of Sekiro, the environments, the absence of a traditional stats leveling system, and the way you increase your core attributes, mana, and health. It also brings to mind Nioh 2, with the ability to equip spirits and its fast-paced gameplay that blends combos and stances seamlessly.The storyline is captivating, brought to life with cartoonish cutscenes brimming with personality. It’s based on Journey to the West, and the game’s polish is evident throughout. The GUI is beautifully designed, sound effects hit just right, and the soundtrack is solid.You play as a pre-made character to stay true to the storyline from the ancient Chinese novel. Armor and weapons are obtained through crafting with resources and currency you collect along the way. Flasks can be customized with items that give you temporary advantages, like increased defense or healing over time. Mechanics and gameplay: Black Myth: Wukong doesn’t rely on traditional stats like endurance, strength, or agility. It offers a skill-based system. You unlock and enhance skills, switching between stances to explore different playstyles. Respeccing is quick and painless, letting you experiment without needing any annoying items, so you’re always in the action, ready to try something new.When you die, there’s no soul-dropping. Seriously, who actually enjoys that feature? I’m glad they left it out.However, the game does have some invisible map walls, and navigation can be a bit confusing at times and to me this is the biggest issue this game has so far.The game kicks off strong, with great enemy variety, stunning maps, and a slew of unique bosses. The difficulty feels fair, not cheap like in Elden Ring.You can equip trinkets, but you’ll stick with the same weapon, which you can modify and upgrade. There are no other weapons, but that doesn’t take away from the experience.Performance:You’ll need a high-end PC to run this game smoothly, especially if you crank up the settings. It could use some optimization, and I wouldn’t be surprised if Denuvo is causing performance issues.Sound and aesthetic: Voice acting is on point, and there are some interesting mechanics like transforming into an insect, bird, or fox, which adds a nice layer of variety. Verdict: Overall, Black Myth: Wukong is a fantastic achievement. It’s got me excited to see what this studio does next. This game deserves its success, and I’m giving it a solid 9 out of 10.

review: 2022 So I've owned this game for a while now, and at first I wasn't going to write a review for it. However, I have recently joined an awesome 1v1 community server that has been so kind to me, so I though I'd incorporate that experience into my review.When people think about the game, Counter Strike: the Global Offensive, they think about player experience. It is a strictly multiplayer game after all... People often refer to a certain toxicity in the general player base in CS, but I would like to shout out this 1v1 server. This server is a server that I have played on, and it is awesome. I have on multiple occasions, opened up about my familial past, and my son, Kurt (light of my life). It often gets shot down by haters or trolls or the like, but on this 1v1 server, I have received so much love... It has honestly been honestly so heart warming...It has gotten to the point where most of the familiar faces on the server renounce when I join the lobby, even asking how my son, Kurt, did in school the previous day. I have also disposed the fact that my wife and I have split up after 15 and a half years of happy marriage, and my friends on the server have been nothing but supportive of me. A typical session usually goes talking about my son, Kurt, the owl my backyard, or World War II documentaries, and it is such a loving time. One of my most recent feats in the server is making it generally a more healthy, kinder place. I have made it a point to say "GG" after every round, to the point that more "evil" players will shout obscenities, saying that you don't have to say "GG" after every round, but that never gets me down. Ever.Anyways, this is getting pretty lengthy, so I'd like to leave this on a high note. I want to shout out this 1v1 server, however I don't remember the name of it. If you do in fact find the certain one I am writing about now, please, reach out and say hello to me (and often my son, Kurt, will be in the same room as me, so you can say hi to him as well)! I have found a new love for the shooting genre of computer games, and I plan on sharing many, many more heart-felt moments with my friends and the ones I meet on the way. Thank you Valve for making this all possible.

review: I do like the story but that is pretty much itPVE is mixed. Most classes are fun some are busted and really make it hard to play other classes because you will think "Damn vanguard sucks I could play tactical and offer so much more utility, and damage to my team by simply existing or I could play sniper and laser down anything that even dares to exist." most of vanguard's perks work only when you are nearly dead and his boltguns are peashooters (Like every other bolter ingame)Starting with only six pve maps is a crazy choice in the modern age with so many different games that have much better pve options as opposed to space marine 2 especally with randomly generated maps. (they should exist within 40k considering how large the universe)Melee combat is done pretty poorly in this game larger enemies just stand there and do nothing when you hit them with your weapons they hardly move away from you or have any moves to break out of an attack chain leading to you just spamming one button until the mob does something else.The guns in this game are so underpowered but then you have stuff like the melta and las fusil and everything underpreforms inbetween those two when the idea should be that each weapon falls somewhere on the scale inbetween the horde clear and single target damage. so many bolters are just plain ♥♥♥♥ which again makes no senseThe enemies are so unfun to fight beacause they have no tactics accept rush and attack or shoot. if the tyranid warriors were weaker and more numerous and rushed you alongside the guants then maybe during the attack or right before it happens or near the tail end other tyranids (lictor, ravenor, nurothropes.) could show up and attack when you are least expecting it to really make it feel like a hivemind trying to force opening in your team's defenseThen the thousands sons could have more unortodox tactics relying on drawing space marines into Killzones with rocket launchers and snipers setup to eat you while the chaos spacemarines lock you up in melee and close-quarters combat Overall if you really wanna try it I would give it two hours and if you really dislike it get a refund. dont get me wrong this game can be fun if you just shut-off your brain

review: Tl;dr, a game designed to take your money hidden by beautiful graphics.The Good: Once Human has very pretty graphics and an oustanding atmosphere I've been missing in a lot of games. The character creator with it's presets allow you lots of freedom - even with your body. Something I've missed in most games where it was either "slim or slightly thicker". The story is interesting and was almost compelling for me to continue. The cinematics and music are pretty to look at and listen to as well.The Bad: In the few hours I've played, I had many moments of "oh that's like x/y game". Usually a compliment, but not in this case - and not in an "they took inspiration from x/y game and implemented it" way but an "let's change 2 things and straight copy/paste it". As I said, the atmosphere is beautiful - but the otherworld (don't call me out on not knowing the names - it's a bit confusing tbf) could be a copy/paste of Control. So far I've felt awful Deja Vu for Prey, Death Stranding, NieR and Control, with heavy emphasis on Control and Death Stranding. Again, not in a good way.I've played a handful of survival games and this one has by far the worst HUD, menu and crafting system - because the game is designed to make money off of microtransactions (which shouldn't be called "micro" considering you have to spent 30€ for a skin). Makes sense, otherwise it wouldn't be free. But then, in my opinion, a survival openworld is the wrong genre to make money off of it. First look into the store I was greeted with a ton of timed events and things happening - many things you have to unlock by money first (should be noted that there's a season pass, which should be a crime in itself for a survival open world).Unimportant HUD things are too large and in the way while important HUD symbols like your thirst and hunger are at an odd place and too small. The crafting menu reminds me of Fortnite tbh. Also there's a crafting queue and timer on how long the thing you wanna craft is going to take. Even though a friend and I chose the same server and same world, we still landed in different ones. No biggie, the teleportation towers brought us together fast. The mc/player feels very... bad, so to say. We have absolutely no facial expressions and we move in a very clunky way (mouse sensitivity on highest setting and somehow it's STILL too slow - have to drag my mouse across the whole mousepad to do a 180). We have few dialogue options for the tutorial intro and I see what they've tried to do with choosing different questions the mc can ask and instead of giving the mc a voice, they let us do weird motions AS IF we were speaking - just that we are not and our face doesn't move an inch. They should have either opted for full voicing like in Mass Effect or none at all and go straight to the dialogue like in Baldur's Gate and similar games where you are presented with dialogue options.Conclusion:The interest in the story and the artstyle was almost enough to convince me to force myself through it. Others may find it entertaining to play - and I really do hope there are some people out there, because the game IS beautiful in what it's trying to be; but so many unimportant or even the wrong things were given too much attention. Sadly, Once Human will stay as a game I looked forward to for a long while, just to be punched in the face. I'll watch it from afar to how the story and progress will unfold itself because I can't force myself to continue. But in all seriousness, I can't recommend the game in a state like this even if it's free.

Multiplayer is fun with great build diversity allowing a fresh experience every time you play it. Also melee combat can feel a little off sometimes in PvE and PvP but its not a game breaking issue. Besides all that the game is great and I highly recommend anyone who is looking for a game with an interesting story and fun pvp to buy this game!
