review: 2022 I like FROM's games and in my opinion this is their best game yet. It has open world dungeons and locations to explore, but it also has "levels" that are the bottleneck for opening up the next part of the story or area which feels very souls-esque and is what keeps the flow very varied.I've been to a particular place 3 times and never came across "the chest" people talk about, nor did I encounter the enemy there that everyone talks about, but I did find a chest that most people miss. It's kind of wild how different people can go to the same area and have totally different experiences or miss certain things. The game is very generous with its "bonfires" aka sites of grace, which was surprising to me.The difficulty is still there and if you aren't feeling like it is for the first chapter it will start presenting itself in later chapters for most players. Your health stats are more important than ever this time around. If you don't have a good 20 to 30 points into Vigor you'll get one-shot by a lot of stuff, so keep that in mind!TIP: If you aren't sure about a boss yet and you don't want to cross the fog unwittingly, just put your summon sign down and help people as many times as you want to learn the boss patterns and even get free souls/items along the way!!! No shame!If you like Dark Souls in any way or if you want a brutal fantasy adventure, yes I recommend this. ((There's currently some tech issues that they know about and are addressing, so if your PC isn't exceeding their specs you might want to wait a moment or just be aware you'll have to turn down your settings.))

review: 2022 Elden Ring is the latest game developed by FromSoftware, a company well-known for its Souls franchise. This time, FromSoftware took a departure from its standard linear/semi-open world approach to its game development. Instead, it opted for an open-world approach, with heavy reliance on Souls’ game mechanics. After I learned that Elden Ring would be developed as an open-world Souls game, I was worried about how the game would turn out. However, Elden Ring turned out to be something far better than I had imagined.Pros:- A vast world filled with activities, secrets, sidequests, enemies, and bosses that will entertain players for hundreds of hours- A wonderful sense of exploration that is unparalleled in its scope and design- Boss battles that are difficult yet extremely satisfying - Beautiful graphics that show noticeable improvements over older titles, such as Dark Souls 3 and Sekiro- Great map system that guides players in the right direction and helps them search for secrets and activities. - A wide variety of weapons with different ashes of war that allows for diverse gameplay- An intuitive and efficient weapon upgrade system - A wide variety of spells, incantations, talismans, and armors to choose from - Stellar aesthetics/art design Cons:- Performance issues: micro-stuttering and framerate drops that got better compared to the launch version but still need more work - While enemies/bosses are mostly fair, a few of them are overly difficult and can feel a little cheap Overall, I think Elden Ring is a masterpiece that offers new possibilities to an open-world genre, which has become somewhat stale in recent years. Similar to what Breath of the Wild did five years ago, Elden Ring proves that the open-world genre can evolve and become something truly remarkable.

review: Emperor forgive me for I am about to speak heresy, but I cannot recommend this game, surely the ruinous powers have corrupted this gift from the Emperor. It plays like any button masher fighting game where you have to press the block button when the bright light icon flashes or press the dodge button when the other bright light flashes. Like other third person fighting button mashers of this genre, ( looking at you Shadow of War ) you're just a weak little guy that can get interrupted repeatedly by any and all enemies when making an attack but when you're right in the enemy's face with a chain sword the enemy acts as if all you're doing is poking them in the face with a stick. Compare this to a game like Bolt Gun where you feel the weight of a Space Marine, where you feel like a Space Marine, and this game comes up more like a clunky third person button masher fighting game rather than a tactical third person shooter where you play the role of a genetically engineered superhuman fighting hordes of xeno scum. 90% of the game I felt weaker than the enemy, and all the special xeno enemies usually just spammed some bs move like any third person button masher and if you miss the prompt, uh oh, there goes most of your health! Honestly the game is more frustrating and though the scenes were beautiful, the atmosphere of the 40k universe absolutely immersive and the overall amazing look of the game, it can't get beyond a clunky combat system that makes you feel more like you're playing Elden Ring having to spam dodge roll away from enemies because if a bunch of specials group up around you, you're basically dead. I know the whole being able to play as your favorite space marine chapter is something not seen much in other 40k video games but honestly, the PvE only has 6 missions at the moment, the PvP was tacked on seemingly at the last minute, and the campaign is an absolute joke for what it's claiming to be. Space Marine sim? The combination of clunky controls, auto hitting enemies with overpowered abilities, and mid to trash combat that makes you feel more like a member of the Astra Militarium than an Ultramarine.Edit: Why in Horus's great bushy bum did the devs decide to give the Tzeetch beastmen invulnerable shields that can only really be broken if you power attack them? That'd be like giving every Tyrannid grunt a shield and saying 'ah ah ah only power attacks' the amount of times I've been surrounded by these shield guys getting ripped apart by thousand sun space marines from a distance because I have to power attack through a whole horde of shielded enemies is completely ridiculous! It's a horde game, you want the low level enemies to be easily killed so you can focus on the high level enemies! Instead it turns into a mosh pit where you lose all your health because you have to focus power attack on each shield man while they keep hitting you every single second.

review: 2023 This game on its own is ok but it is a true gem when you can assemble the previous games and its DLC into a state of completeness. I love this series and it will likely go down as one of my all time favorites. That being said, I cannot recommend this game for the very same reason.Creative Assembly has time and again left game breaking bugs for months upon months and have recently allowed a critical part of a paid DLC (Kroxigors for Nakai from The Hunter and the Beast) broken to the point that essentially half the DLC was unplayable. Don't worry, they were still happy to charge full price for it during this time. The most recent DLC has a massive price hike with debateably less content. On top of this, the FreeLC offers nowhere near the benefit of what has been historically accompanied a DLC release.The devs and artists do amazing work and create fantastic experiences when they're properly staffed and funded but I cannot recommend a game that is essentially the scaffolding to hang great DLC off of when the DLC and support is failing to deliver. This game is being treated as a money pinata by the leadership of the company to fund other projects and I cannot recommend this product or any other from Creative Assembly while it is so blatantly being given the least amount of attention possible while charging as much as possible.Edit: I want to make sure its clear that I cannot recommend a game or its DLC when its possible that what you buy may get critically broken and then not fixed for months. Even if the content itself is worth the price at the time there is no excuse to have multiple instances of paid-for content being left broken for months.

review: 2016 11/29/23Game is rampart with cheaters and many team killers, they will shoot on spawn because you do not speak their language for no reason, it is very common, they will persist until they get banned. You cannot do anything about it and Valve just does not care.The only thing certain is that you will loose the game. I can send you as many replays as you want with this.10/15/23 review update/revised reviewI gave a try to CS:2 today, I played 5 games. It is by far the worst gaming experience I ever had in my entire life.To begin with I believe when I left CS:GO some weeks ago I had the rank of either DMG or LE. I do not remember. Then I was like let's try the new game, I was very excited. After these 5 games I was left stunned, wondering the state of our race and the prospects of our future. Either the IQ of the general population has dropped or the game attracts creatures that their categorization as "human" in some circles could be at best questionable to the extent that it makes you rethink some your values, like your stance against abortion and other sensitive matters that have been solved many years now regarding the humanity as a species..I need to add for context that I never swear at my teamates, I never insult them, I never shoot them back but in the last game I actually lost my tempter, to the point that things got out of hand, I realized that the last game was no different from the previous ones, I just had enough.I will explain.If you enjoy playing with people that choose random maps - THAT THEY DO NOT KNOW - like Vertigo (I do not even know why this map is in the ranked pool anyway), teammates that shoot you, disconnect for no reason, in general scream on the microphone or do not understand the basic fundamentals of the complicated concept of the "Bomb defusal" game rules and game style, then yes! You have found your game! Your teamates will rush towards the enemy even if they are CT, they will mostly die in the first 10 seconds and then they will either start cursing at you at you or teamkill you at spawn, flash you or other stuff, what can you do?ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. You will be forced to spend the next minutes of your life with them, I mean about people that must find the tree that produces the oxygen they spend and to whom they need to apologize for their inexcusable behavior towards other human beings. Valve doesn't give a flying fifu about your fun, or the toxic people you are forced to play with.It is nearly impossible to comprehend the level of toxicity and darkness that you will endure playing this game and having to live with this Exercise in futility, comparing this to works of Russian authors like Dostoevsky, Solzhenitsyn and Tolstoy will make you feel you are reading a woke Hollywood comedy.Old review --->I had a lot of fun some years back in the 2012-2014 reaching the rank of Supreme mostly playing with friends but also as solo. I came back this year to try the game again after some absence from the scene. WTF has happened? This game has the worst community possible, it antagonizes the one that LoL has but I guess here things are worse. If you don't speak Russian you are doomed to play in competitive servers with people that don't speak English at all in about 80% of your matches, these guys use the VOIP system to speak Russian even if they are just 2 out the 5 players in your team, their only communication is shooting you or try to kick you if they think you do something wrong.DON'T GET ME WRONG HEREI have a lot of Russian friends through other games and they are really nice people.Apart from the Russians another portion of the community is immature people, they go harsh on teammates, bash them, trolling them and in generally trying to prove something, these disputes in many cases end up with the player being either the attacker or the defender leaving the game or getting banned for friendly fire, about 80% of the times you play you will end up playing a 4vs5 Match (at least in my DMG and LE levels that I played this year). This is a team game, you can't win by yourself but most people don't get it. If you reach a higher level of skill it doesn't mean that you are also a good player in terms of tactics and strategies.Another negative thing is the 64tick rate servers that the competitive system uses, I believe this is set to allow distant players to have a decent ping and/or to save resources for the servers. This thing ruins the game too, it makes aiming really funny, you will understand If you ever go on a LAN server or play on a 128 tick rate server, this will result into playing a totally different game. The way the rates work now is that the attacking player has always the advantage as prefiring won't leave the defender time to react.There is huge but in all this:Are you willing to pay a subscription?If you have 4 dedicated friends to play the game with I guarantee you that you will have an excellent time if you decide to go play somewhere where you pay to play like ESEA and FACEIT with a better community. There you will find descent people that value their money and are willing to play in a higher level without having to take all this *love* mentioned above.This review is written in frustration after playing 5 consecutive 4vs5 games only with non englsh-speaking teammates. And this scenario this year doesn't happen for the first time.

review: Of course, this game has some problems here and there, but overall it's acceptable and plays pretty well. I would say this is a "cozy place to relax" type of game. review: 2022 ELDEN RING, O ELDEN RING...Where to begin with this one? Fromsoftware's journey from Demon's Souls in 2009 all the way to here leaves us in the incredible foundations of what could be considered their best game yet, utilising the familiar Soulsborne format while spinning it into a full-fledged open world. The game is utterly jam packed with things to discover, fight, and oddball characters with weird, esoteric stories and motives. A game with an insane vision and incredible imagination.Having finished it about 160 hours in, my expectations probably should have been tempered. Context time; I've beaten almost every game in Fromsoftware's modern lineup with the exception of Demon's Souls, due to not owning a PS3 or PS5. I've gone out of my way to seek the greatest challenges, from Charmless/Demon Bell runs in Sekiro to the Queen Yharnam trophy in Bloodborne. Elden Ring starts off not too dissimilar to Dark Souls 3 and will seem incredibly familiar from there, with the magic meter returning (along with split Healing/magic bar flasks) and its weapon arts exchanged for a new system called Ashes of War, allowing you to chop and change various skills into a variety of mundane weapons, creating entirely brand new playstyles and strategies. Magic is stronger than ever with spell slots being completely independent of the stat that increases your magic bar, actively encouraging you to seek out magic to use. This makes the game's first stretch incredibly replayable as you experiment with various Ashes and spell and weapon combinations that compliment each other. Even better is that exploration from your first playthrough is rewarded in the next, as you can skip a surprising number of bosses and encounters to find strong equipment or spells early and use it as a base for your new run. This is some of the best character building in any of these games, and the world never stops being absolutely breathtaking to look at and experience.Unfortunately, it seems Elden Ring eventually buckles under its ambitions in an attempt to top what came before it. The game is relatively challenging from Limgrave all the way up to past the Altus Plateau and Leyndell, the Royal Capital, and then skyrockets in difficulty. In recognising that the game has to somehow challenge dozens of different player character builds and hundreds of potential Ash of War combinations, it becomes what might be Fromsoftware's hardest game ever put to code. What were once difficult bosses are now reused as regular enemies with impunity. Input reading is rampant, gank bosses are common place, enemies are Sekiro/Bloodborne-tier aggressive with staggered combos and extreme delays and area-of-effect attacks in a game where you play as a relatively slow Dark Souls 3 character. Lategame healthpools are absolutely titanic, difficult to stance break, and even characters with high damage numbers begin to struggle without help from summons, Bleed or Frostbite (especially Bleed, given it's a status proc that scales infinitely no matter how big the healthbar).The open world format both benefits and hurts the game, because almost all of its good design is in 60-80% of its runtime, with the last two areas being a gauntlet of no less than five of the absolute hardest bosses in the game. By the time I was done with those monsters-- four of which I could not at all beat without the help of a certain extremely strong spirit summon-- I was fatigued, and incredibly tired, rather than feeling accomplished at all. My advice is to play as dirty as humanly possible if you're struggling with those. It's a life or death battle, after all.Despite those few hitches just before an absolutely fantastic ending, I'd say Elden Ring is still worth your money and time, if you can spare either. Don't go in expecting anything other than another Dark Souls, this time with some of the words switched around and much bigger, and you'll have a grand time of it.

review: Having never played souls before I find this game incredibly hard, not so hard I want to destroy my controller - but damn hard. Of course I'm not a gamer and I don't usually review games, but the biased nonsense from the... ahem... 'game journalists...' has made me give this an honest review. Amazing. Wukong is worth every penny. The graphics are great, you fee like an anime protag when you jump or complete certain moves. You can reset your skill points at anytime at a shrine for free and it allows you to play different styles to try them out. Also if a boss is too hard you can go back beat up some mobs, get more points and get stronger. It's a linear game but the paths make it feel like a small open world at times. all in all a great game and you should play. The only bad part is I have a 14th gen intell POS chip and I had to reduce the overclocking to play without it crashing. I also had to set global lighting lower to be able to see the dark areas as sometimes it was just black on my screen. If its crashing for you download the intel xtreme utility and reduce the overclock modifier (?) I had to reduce mine to x53 before it stopped crashing. now it only happens once every few days which to me is acceptable.

review: Pros:Graphics, voice-acting are good. An attempt was made to be faithful to the lore. Decent visuals of combat, good amount of finishers, gore, and satisfying kills.Weapon upgrade system provides some level of meta.Cons:Gameplay - clunky. the Space Marines don't move like Space Marines, but rather more like Fallout power armor... maybe even less agile. Do you want 6 different kinds of boltguns that all kinda suck? How about low ammo for all weapons? Remember the last little guy in Vermintide 1 that would do most of the damage after a fight? Those guys are in here.Price - very expensive for what you are gettingUI - very cumbersome: long presses with confirm windows are common, controls obviously made for console/controllerLore - they mostly do a decent job, but then will randomly have glaring errors. For instance, the Iron Warriors main colour being gold... what. The commanding officer of the Cadians has an accent different from her troops for... reasons? Speaking of, the Cadians are done dirty. They are in no way capable of holding the line against the Tyranids unless they are given plot armor. The banter between Space Marines is probably not something that would occur either. Some of the flavor text for the legions/chapters is wrong (Minotaurs come to mind). Scaling - is off. Vehicles are too small, CSM are too big compared to Primaris. Campaign/Story - 'Hey SM1, can I copy your homework? Sure, just change it a bit so it looks different."Other game modes:Operations (PVE): linear maps, same objectives, same maps, same enemies. Eternal War (PVP): I had no interest in playing. Obviously tacked on at the end. Chaos doesnt have any cosmetic customization other than color. For instance, do you want a green World Eater? How about a yellow Deathguard? CSM weapons are the same, even though they shouldn't be (they are reskins of primaris equivalents).Classes - absolute cancer. You are restricted to only taking 1 class on missions (so of 3 players in PVE, they MUST be a unique class). Maybe this is primaris ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ or maybe this is a gameplay choice. Not sure, but it seems like a random injection of hero shooter to something that isnt. This game is gonna have a very short lifespan. Compared to other 40k titles that have released recently, this simply does not compete.I'll probably keep playing it, as several of my friends are and request my assistance... and to get my money's worth.

review: 2022 Elden RingLet me start by saying this was the first game I played created by FromSoftware (well except for killing the first boss in DS3 - which doesn't really count, does it?). I wasn't caught up in the Elden Ring hype and I wasn't really interested in the game even after it's release. It didn't even come up in my mind to even look at it, as I thought it wouldn't be the right game for me. And oh boy was that a mistake. About a month ago I finally decided to look into the game and almost instantly decided to get it.Not being interested in the game from the start actually made me enjoy it that much more. I wasn't hyped up from any trailers, media or rumors. I went into the game with a clean slate. And it was amazing. From the first time hearing the AWESOME soundtrack in the menu to exploring the crazy world of Lands Between - and let me tell you I barely scratched the surface of what the world has to offer.The world really feels alive. It's crazy how from previous - mostly linear - games the devs managed to create such an impressive open world. The map is HUGE and there isn't an area which feels empty and out of place. Each location really feels different and tells it's own story.There are some let's say tedious locations, I'm looking at you Mountaintops of the Giants, that get a bit annoying after playing through the game several times. Nevertheless even these snow-covered depressing hills deserve a special places in any gamer's heart. I won't mention any other locations because it would be a sin to spoil any of them.Locations being behind us, let's move onto the people inhabiting the Lands Between. The NPCs are there for themselves not for the player. That makes them feel really alive - you've never met this guy? Well he certainly doesn't care because he was doing his thing anyways. And that's crazy. The world is constantly evolving and the NPCs are too. And not just that, the people you meet during your adventure are as interesting as it gets. There weren't many times I could certainly say "Okay, this NPC is good, pure-hearted and they will surely stay that way!". The craziest thing is you might not meet even half of the NPCs if you're just playing the game for the sake of reaching the end.Bosses will kick your ass and those bastards will look cool doing it. Damn I wish I was born a cool boss too. But hey tough luck foul tarnished. Get some shiny gear and kick their ass for a change. After all you're ambitious and surely not foolish at all - Margit the goat fanboy.Elden Ring has 6 unique endings. That's all I'm gonna say about that. Though don't expect to be an Elden Ring Expert after your first... or tenth playthrough. The lore is, as FromSoft is known for, hidden in every possible way there is. You get a new weapon? You thought, it's lore in disguise. You got a completely useless pot which is completely useless? Oh wait it's got ten paragraphs of lore in it's description. Honestly if you really want to know atleast a bit of lore or you're interested in a certain character, I recommend you to look up external sources about them, such as youtube videos or useful lore sites. But be warned, there are still numerous mysteries which even the most notorious loreheads are still uncertain about. But hey, that's the beauty of it all, isn't it?I have to say, I don't think there currently is and for a long time will be any better entry point to FromSoft games. Even though, Elden Ring still doesn't exactly help you get through and still kicks your ass every chance it gets, it's a fun ass kicking. And I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone even a bit interested in the genre or in the game itself.It might even be time to announce a DLC reveal, what do you say FromSoft? ...pretty please?TLDR: Game of the year - do I need to add anything else? Wait... Actually I do. There are Waifus. FromSoft boys truly outdone themselves.

review: 2023 Edit: so they changed their DLC pricing to something more manageable so I'm changing back my review to recommend the game again. But I'm keeping the original review on here and will just as easily change it back to not recommended if they pull anything else like that again.Okay Warhammer you can fix your DLC price now so you can go back to being my favorite game again!! Seriously though, only thing wrong with the game is the cost of the latest DLC. Looks like it introduced some fun mechanics into the game, but I'm sorry we've already had scheme-y factions added (See, all Skaven especially Snikch, and Tzeench daemons). We as a community can understand needing to raise the prices for future DLC but making is a sudden 150% hike above the previous cost is just nasty. The Chaos Dwarves DLC price raise was risky but we all thought it was arguably worth it for a "new" race, but still expensive for what it is because let's be honest it's just a variation of existing in game races. The moment the cost of your DLC returns to a reasonable level this review will be changed to recommend, but until then I can't recommend my favorite game to anyone. And as someone who also plays 40k and sigmar table top it takes a lot for me to complain about cost.

review: 2022 The gameplay, race options, the prologue and the overall experience (strategic game) are fun and impressive. The game is beautiful and immersive. But, and it's a rage quit kind of but, you hit turn 30 of the chaos campaign and the mechanics kicks in and it all goes downhill. While the portals are exciting and some of the realm are fun and thematic, having other factions rush you at that time (preventing you from visiting them) and having the realm experience feel long and unfair (at least you can auto-resolve the last battle) drains the fun out of it. I finished it once, made it to the fourth soul before deciding it wasn't worth finishing on the 2nd playthrough and keep dropping out earlier and earlier on the other playthrough I've tried. Overall, I feel there's a really fun game underneath but that the campaign kills the enjoyment out of it. Having played the immortal empire campaign my review kinda stands : it feels ridiculously unbalanced from one faction to the next and, having tried many, I'm finding that it's a mix of fun and frustration. The base game fun is there but playing whack-a-mole on armies trashing your unprotectable smaller settlements, the sometimes stacked-against-you-against-logic of the AI and very uneven enjoyability of the different races and mechanics makes playing the game a frustrating experience.

review: 2022 Where to start?Well, the game is broken. You can loose it, by sheer bad luck due to its game mechanics.So you can spend 100ish hours on doing all the right moves in a campaing and then you get squashed by randomness making a AI faction with 4 settlements on the opposite side of the map able to win faster than you. And there is nothing you can do about it and latest patch did NOTHING to fix this ♥♥♥♥.The realms of the Gods are broken, especially Tzeenth.Other than that, the Chaos Undivided Faction really is a poor excuse for a faction, the Daemon lord really is just a weird jack of all/no trades. And gives no joy to play with really. Cathay is weirdly overpowered and the Kislevites are just having a bad time. Playing as Khorne you just dominate everything and dont get me started on the broken Auto Resolve, with 3x the strength you will still risk loosing 90% of your forces on something that might cost you 2% if you play it. Game is weirdly consistent on really demanding that you play the battles no matter how trivial.Oh, and if you got a bad ass lord as a Chaos faction, and the lord gets the nurgle corruption trait, you can now never loose the trait and your lord is actually broken since his forces will never regenerate, not even in a city. And you always end up getting this trait while fighting Nurgle. Broken mechanic when you cant cure it as Chaos, while all other factions can cure it.Anyways, wait till it is on a sale and Mortal/Immortal Empires or what it's called is ready.Also, why did they have to break the UI? Warhammer I and II and beutiful UIs now everything is this weird dark red color scheme that doesnt match the game.Oh and dont get me started on siege battles, sure they needed to get some form of a fix from Warhammer II. But this ♥♥♥♥ with constantly regenerating/rebuilding towers and weird Tower Defense like mechanics just does not work. review: At the moment the gameplay loop is just ♥♥♥♥♥♥For melee:- Chip damage is way to high with no tools of either preventing it, or replenishing health. (EDIT: A melee with "fencing" defence type has significantly reduced this problem)- The idea of trying to keep getting armour as if it was replenishing health just isn't a sound one. The chances to replenish it are rare, but on top of that armour has such little HP and therefore what you regain is insignificant and often immediately lost. - Parry is so odd. Not only have I found that holding the parry button delivers better results, but also a successful parry timing is done BEFORE the hit would land, unlike all other famous parry systems.This is not an inherently bad idea, I think it's quite novel and interesting. Especially with the imagery of a parry that is prepared for being better than a parry that is "just in time". However this utterly ♥♥♥♥♥ the bed against small enemies in hordes. There is no predicting in a horde, there are attacks all the time and when you see an enemy wind up and you prepare to parry, that parry is highjacked by a random enemy that you weren't prepared for, turning your Perfect Parry into the ♥♥♥♥ parry. This leads to you getting STUNLOCKED which is a cardinal ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ sin in games like these. Absolute wank. (EDIT: This is completely removed by using a "Fencing" defence type weapon. Using one removes the "just in time" parry and makes all successful parries the same *actual* parry. Although this makes the game much much more playable and fun and removes the stunlocking, I kinda liked the preparing idea and would like to see it delegated to rare and boss heavy attacks).Ranged:- Guns feel like ♥♥♥♥♥ in terms of damage. A Rubric Marine cannot tank 20 Bolt rounds to the face unless the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ is named.- Ammo is rare as ♥♥♥♥ and because of the mentioned above, is absolutely useless as you burn right through it. I only don't feel this rarity when maining a melee class for obvious reasons.Misc:- What the everliving ♥♥♥♥ did they do to the Jump Pack in Operations? I don't give a ♥♥♥♥ if I could fall out the map, just spawn me on top of a Player or NPC if that happens. There is no good reason to have neutered it so massively.- also why is customisation just kind of poor? I guess more will come later but just in what I'm able to change, SM1 was superior. Why can't I change lens colour or thigh armour colour? And the fact there is only Mark X ♥♥♥♥♥ me off. Give me my gorgeous Mk 7 helmet and please don't make me pay £10 for it.- The loading screens are abysmal and absurd. Sometimes it is faster to task manager the game out of existence than to sit through loading screens- EDIT: the new fencing weapons feel kind of OP? I know it sounds like I'm complaining that one of my problems mentioned above is now fixed, but I can now just spam-parry my way out of minor-hordes. Not very engaging, stimulating or cognitive.Fixes:- Either reduce the damage Minor enemies deal in melee (one Tzeench minion should not take a whole bar off my shield), OR increase shield HP (shield HP is decent in Mini-boss events like Helbrutes so if HP is raised, so should Helbrute's damage by slightly), OR increase shield regen from specific enemy executions. Rubric marines should not give 1 shield with how much damage they deal, OR increase the health recovery after taking damage lifespan. It goes away far to fast to actually act upon.- Have an more purposeful way to regain shield. I get nearly all of my Gun Strikes just unexpectedly, even though I'm always attempting to bash and stun enemies. Make bashing leading to a Gun Strike more consistent for minor enemies. - You should not have to use the Prepare Parry mechanic for minor enemies. Not only does it play like ♥♥♥♥, they just aren't strong strong enough to put a Space Marine on the back foot.- Buff the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Jump pack in Operations. It should go as far and be active as much as the campaign or PVP. "Oh the slam, it would be too OP" then nerf the slam damage dibshit.I'm going to keep playing this game every now and then in hopes that the higher class level experience is better, but it can't be a good game if I have to slog through ♥♥♥♥ for 25 hours just to get it to play nice. Also I haven't tried PVP yet but I didn't come here to do that, I came to slaughter xenos and traitors and indulge in a rare substance called fun.

review: A Kaleidoscope Of FunOnce Human invites players into a world fraught with fear, where lifeless objects reanimate into hostile creatures intent on human extinction. Guided by an otherworldly figure, players must battle formidable boss-type enemies to edge closer to a prospective salvation, which remains uncertain. Amidst these dangers, bonds of friendship and camaraderie strengthen among the inhabitants. Forging new armors and weapons enhances survivability, erecting walls and defenses safeguards against threats, and collecting Deviations (the game’s equivalent of Pokémon) advances players into adept survivalists.GameplayThe core gameplay of Once Human revolves around survival-craft, with a primary focus on resource gathering. This aspect is well-balanced, avoiding an excessively grindy feel. Base building epitomizes this balance, as creating a fully furnished home requires only a few hours of resource gathering and planning.Crafting is efficient, with most recipes completing in seconds. Bulk crafting takes only a few minutes, providing time to manage the base or review character skills and stats. Various methods to expedite and increase the yield of crafting items cater to those with limited patience.Deviations, the game’s Pokémon-esque companions, are found through quests or at the end of boss levels. They serve various roles, from crafting and gathering resources to combat. Unlike its contemporary Palworld, which offers numerous companions, Once Human makes them rarer, enhancing their impact. Players are encouraged to experiment to find the Deviation that best suits their playstyle.Gunplay is satisfying, encouraging players to seek cover and capitalize on attack opportunities. While reminiscent of The Division, it is less complex. Combat includes a dodge-roll, frequently used in boss fights and player skirmishes. Smooth animations add weight to actions, showcasing the development team’s attention to detail.Quests are scattered throughout the world, with main quests guiding the narrative and side quests rewarding players with Deviations, experience points, and resources. Various world quests incite the server’s population to either collaborate or compete for victory and rewards. PvP enthusiasts will appreciate the forced-PvP high-value locations, akin to The Division’s “Dark Zone.”Areas for ImprovementAs a new game, Once Human has a few bugs, though none cause crashes. Visual glitches, such as weapons not appearing in hands or enemies teleporting when stuck in walls, are noticeable. These issues are likely to be addressed in future updates.While crafting is generally balanced, collecting wood takes longer relative to its usage. Converting wood to charcoal for smelting ores and crafting ammo depletes the resource quickly.The abundance of menus can be overwhelming, making navigation and reward claiming challenging. The game has much to offer but requires better visual organization. UI/UX improvements are essential to enhance the overall experience.SummaryIn conclusion, Once Human offers a kaleidoscope of engaging mechanics, presenting a visually stunning world with thrilling combat and survival elements. With a dedicated development team that values player feedback and respects players’ time, this game has strong potential to evolve into something exceptional. Embark on this immersive journey and uncover the true essence of survival.

review: 2022 What can I say? Honestly I do not know how I can talk about this game in its current state, as I write this review I have played WH1, 2 and now 3 and honestly this game feels like early access, the unit mass is off, formations feels like they dont matter because Orgres spam, Demon Spam, Chariot spam and even BASIC infantry can just barge through your space marine kislevites and your halbardiers like a wet paper bag. Range units cant fire less than 10 degrees without moving the whole unit and by the way... they're a lot slower now as all infantry is.. oh and none of them can fire if ONE of them is caught on a twig (or another enemy unit in this case). And as I mentioned earlier, your big strong, anti-large infantry? yeah.. paper bag. (or in my experience, facing the wrong way because ONE Orgre, soul grinder or chariot decided to run decided to run through them and now the whole unit is being attacked from behind, shot at and targeted down because the archers looked tasty.) *This is one of MANY examples by the way, there is simply too many more for me to count*This is one issue I have noticed out of place, too many to even count, I have tried to watch Youtubers to see if I am going something wrong and I am not, simply the game is unbalanced, half finished and simply frustrating to play in its current state as it is full as bugs. (look at ElichTV and his Great Book of Bugs) So how do we fix this? oh lets release a multiplayer patch and then a patch for Alt Tab or something idk. What about fixing issues with the game? oh no lets just explain its very complicated to do. Okay so what will you do for the fans? Lets write a blog post fix some of the things early next month. This is not good enough for a AAA game studio, its honestly so saddening, disappointing and borderline infuriating.I'll just end it on this. Long story short I can go on and on and on about all the unbalanced autoresolve or paper bag infantry who are either killed too quickly or sent halfway across the map by my chariot to get back up again as an angry armoured bear and Co. smashing into you does nothing, but this game is not worth your money, wait for a discount or a decent patch in the next year or five. CA, if you ever read this, next time listen to your fans and the YOUTUBERS you USED to SELL YOUR BROKEN GAME and have THOUSANDS of hours in your games, as personally I believe they know more about what needs to change than what you do and the probability is, you can make MORE MONEY from it if thats all you truly care about as the game will be what the players want and not some broken, overpriced early access launch that you make up excuses for. PS, I am sorry if this review is all over the place, I've never been the best at writing and explaining myself but I think the point I'm making is clear, this game currently is not worth it.

We will hurt it so badly that it will never forget us until the stars burn out and the Emperor vanquishes it at the end of time. When Chaos is dying, its last thought will be of us. That is our memorial - carved into the heart of Chaos. We cannot lose, we have already won.

review: Although Once Human is a well made and entertaining game, I can only recommend it to players with plenty of spare time or are happy to rush through the game to complete it before the 6 week season ends. Once Human needs private servers or 'permanent seasons (with no server wipes)' for a number of reasons, including:- Casual players want to take their time to explore the map - There is far too much content to cover in 6 weeks for players who work and/or have limited play time - Some players primarily enjoy the base building aspect and don't want their experience, deviants and base wiped - Having both seasonal and private/permanent servers would provide a variety of game development, community growth and moneymaking opportunities for developers.Side note: Content you buy with real world money should be transferable to other worlds/servers (it isn't at the moment).I will be waiting for these important issues to be dealt with before I commit to adding Once Human to my permanent game rotation.

review: 2022 This game is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ disgrace which is saying a lot even for a CA game. I've literally never written a review but this game....oh boy this game, I'll make an exception for.2 long legendary campaigns (140 hours at time of writing and thousands on total war games in general) ended abruptly when I couldn't teleport to the *SPOILER* forge of souls to intercept the enemy. I literally got the prompt to go there so I did, and waited there for 10+ turns. No battle option ever came up and upon one of my turns completing was given 'you've failed to intercept, campaign lost'. Like seriously? Didn't have the option with BOTH campaigns. This isn't even an isolated issue. Search up 'forge of souls issue' and it feels like no ones able to finish a campaign. How did this garbage get past playtesting? Not to mention the Tzeentch faction mechanic of just pausing all your movement for a turn. You know what makes warhammer suck in real life? Uninteractable 'gotchas' that require no skill and you can't do ♥♥♥♥ about them. With normal overworld you can at least assasinate/wound heroes that try to block your movement. This is just a random frustration feature that adds nothing to gameplay Why would you give this to the ai when its not being used by a player? How does this enhance or add to the strategic play of the game when it randomly stops all your strategic movement EVERY 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ TURNS, how can you be so oblivious to such an obviously trash and frustrating feature?Everyone who tells you they like minor settlement battles hasn't played 100000 of them on every campaign that isn't on toddler difficulty. Too long, nonsensical, too frequent, and autoresolve just sucks (t5 garrisons 'decisive loss' vs t1 unit rebel blobs. In battle itself - I have no idea if this is intentional but it is still trash of a mechanic-your units response times are like a dial up internet connection to china in 1990. I sincerely hope this is a me incident but compared to other total warhammer games or even total war games in general your units have terrible response times to commands. This could be another attempt at a 'feature' that just ends up being frustration inducing.'realism' dictates a lag in executing orders after receiving them but this is still a game. I'm not looking to fight my own units to go forwards. Maybe its to make it harder to dodge magic but just feels like meaningless lag added to piss you off. Speaking of further pissing someone off, missile units are worse than ever with pathfinding. hundreds of times i've had them shoot something literally in front of them with no impediments and not only will they not fire but they'll just run straight into melee. Other TW games had this issue too but never to this extent. Its too the point where I don't even want to issue attack orders with a line of missile troops because its so hard to have them shoot to begin with without having to micro all of them to not charge into them when its an unimpeded sight line to the target. I was super excited to try out cathays close range rifles until I realized they never fired at your target unless they were autotargeting. Its like they took everything good about the other TW WH games and just made them suck. Oh not to mention unit formations means ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when even the ai just decides to pull entire units through your ranks or a shieldwall to touch your archers or artillery.With crap mechanics and unstable gameplay, I wouldn't touch this game until a couple years after launch and they remove the stupid mechanics they added. There are improvements to diplomacy like allegiance income and trading settlements, but fudnamentally, this game feels clunky, unresponsive, and is frustrating to play.Wait till patches fix everything.

review: 2022 After 100 hours i can say that its one of my favourite games ever and it might just be my favourite Fromsoft title. For me, they nailed every aspect of what i love about the Souls titles and put it into an expansive and aesthetically gorgeous world. Being honest i cannot praise the visual and area design enough, it feels like Ds1 but larger and more grand. I personally hail Ds1's design as "perfect" as can be so take what i said as you will. As usual the music is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ fantastic too. So so many new types of spells and incantations which open up many more interesting types of builds than we've had before. Ive personally planned a multitude of themed characters to play through both in PvP and PvE. The lore of Elden Ring is also superb and i think also the most accessible lore so far in a Fromsoft title. Also General Radahn is an absolute chad. My only criticisms of Elden Ring would be the copy pasted bosses as general enemies in late areas of the game or having 2x the boss for a boss fight. I personally feel like they're a crutch and also diminish earlier emotions of victory from beating a boss and 2x bosses in an area is, IMO, "lazy" Elden Ring is a BIG game, perhaps one of the largest ive ever played but to me everything about Elden Ring is big and grand and just absolutely deserves your attention. No other game company has made an open world game so well as Fromsoft.

ยา หรือกระทั่งวิญญาณที่เรียกออกมาให้ช่วยสู้ด้านกราฟฟิคเนื่องจากผู้เขียนได้เกมฟรีจากการซื้อการ์ดจอของค่ายเขียวยี่ห้อ Galax 4070 แบบธรรมดา 12Gb ตัวเกมปรับกราฟฟิคเป็นสูงสุดมาให้อัตโนมัติตั้งแต่เข้าเกมมาและด้วยขุมพลังของ CPU Intel I7 10700 สามารถทำเฟรมเรทได้ที่ 55+ ไม่ต่ำไปกว่านี้ถือว่าค่อนข้างโอเค และรองรับ DLSS เต็มรูปแบบ การประมวลผลภาพที่ได้มาคือ “ขนลิงมันเป็นขนลิงเลยอะ” ขนเป็นขน เนียนกริ๊บ แสงเงา เท็กส์เจอร์ก้อนหิน ใบไม้ หรือเงาต่าง ๆ ถือว่าทำออกมาได้ดีมาก ส่วนปัญหาเรื่องกราฟฟิคมีเพียงช่วงเปลี่ยนฉากทิศทางแสงจะเปลี่ยนอย่างเห็นได้ชัดเจน อย่างเช่นอยู่ในถ้ำเราจะเห็นแดดนอกถ้ำทะแยงแสงมาจากฝั่งขวา แต่พอออกจากถ้ำแล้วมีการโหลดฉาก แสงก็เปลี่ยนทิศทางไปเป็นฝั่งซ้ายเฉยเลย...ก็มีบ้างเนื้อเรื่องตัวเกมทำออกมาได้เรียบง่าย เส้นทางค่อนข้างเป็นทางตรง มีทางแยกบ้าง แต่สุดท้ายก็จะไปบรรจบที่เดียวกัน ถึงจะดูเหมือนเส้นตรงก็จริงแต่ด้วยความที่เกมไม่ได้มอบมินิแมพหรือแผนที่มาให้เลย อาจทำให้มีหลงเส้นทางอยู่บ้างในช่วงเริ่มแรก แต่ก็มีคุณค่ามากพอแก่การเดินหลงสำรวจให้ครบถ้วน เพราะจะมีไอเทมหรือบอสลับอยู่มากมายรอคอยการเจอของคุณอยู่ เมื่อค้นพบหรือเอาชนะมันลงได้ อาจได้รับไอเทมที่ใช้ในการอัพเกรดของต่าง ๆ และสามารถนำไปอัพเกรดได้ที่ศาลเจ้าที่เปรียบเสมือนจุด Checkpoint และจุดเกิดซึ่งเรียงรายอยู่ตามทางได้ศัตรูเกมนี้จะมีออกมาตามทางให้เป็นระยะ ๆ ไม่ล้นเกร่อแบบเกมออนไลน์ทั่วไป อย่างจำพวกกี้ ๆ จะมาพอให้กรุ้มกริ่มเป็นการวอร์มอัพข้อมือข้อนิ้วก่อนจะไปเจอมินิบอสที่เรียงรายตามทางทุก ๆ 10-15นาที ฝีมือบางตัวร้ายการพอฟัดพอเหวี่ยง บางตัวปรากฏตัวอย่างอลังการขู่ขวัญเราด้วยขนาดตัวและกล้ามล่ำ ๆ แต่หากเราจับทริคมันได้จะง่ายขึ้นมาก บางตัวแทบไม่จำเป็นต้องใช้ยาเลย แต่แลกกับการตายซ้ำซากอยู่นานโขและอาจซื้อจอยอันใหม่มาแทนที่ หรืออย่างร้ายสุดคือตายจนจำบทพูดเย้ยหยันของบอสจนเอาไปพูดตามได้เลย (ฮา)ศัตรูแต่ละตัวหากเราฆ่าได้เป็นตัวแรกจะปลดล็อกเนื้อหาของมัน สามารถเข้าถึงเรื่องราวเกี่ยวกับศัตรูตัวนั้น และเมื่อพิชิตบอสประจำฉากได้จะมีอนิเมชั่นให้เราได้ดูเนื้อเรื่อง อีกทั้งสามารถดูแผนผังและคำบรรยายของภาพนั้นหลังจากจบฉากนั้นได้อีกด้วยการต่อสู้ในเกมนี้ทำได้ค่อนข้างสนุก กระชับ ชัดเจน ใช้โจมตีเบาเพื่อสะสมเกจพลังเพื่อโจมตีหนักใช้เป็นคอมโบต่อเนื่องหรือจะชาร์จเพื่อโจมตีหนักทีเดียวแบบหนักหน่วงก็ได้ตามสไตล์ของเรา ท่วงท่าการโจมตีมีให้ถึงสามแบบด้วยกัน ซึ่งแต่ละสกิลมีให้อัพแยกย่อยลงมาอีกมากมาย อีกทั้งทักษะแขนงอื่นอย่างทักษะติดตัว เพิ่มเลือด เพิ่มมานา หรือสเตมิน่า มาคอยให้เราเก็บเวลได้ติดงอมแงมแบบกู่ไม่กลับแน่นอน แต่ถ้าถามว่ามีข้อเสียไหมในระบบการต่อสู้เกมนี้ ต้องขอตอบว่ามี และเป็นข้อเสียขนาดใหญ่เสียด้วย(เป็นความคิดเห็นส่วนตัว) นั่นคือมุมกล้องที่ออกแบบมาได้แคบมาก และไม่มีตัวเลือกให้ปรับให้มุมมองกว้างขึ้นมาได้ อีกทั้งหากสู้ในที่แคบ ๆ มุมกล้องเราจะไม่ทะลุกำแพง นั่นหมายความว่ามุมมองเราจะถูกบีบให้ใกล้ตัวละครจนเห็นแต่หลังตัวละคร หรือบางครั้งการล็อกเป้าหมายโจมตีศัตรูที่ตัวเตี้ยกว่า มุมกล้องเราจะถูกกดให้ต่ำลง ส่งผลให้มองเห็นแค่พื้นในมุมมองที่แคบ หากเราถูกรุม เป็นเรื่องยากมากที่จะไม่เสียเลือดเสียเนื้อ นอกจากคนเล่นจะเป็นนิวไทป์น่ะนะ... และอีกข้อหนึ่งที่สำคัญ หากเราต้องการชาร์จโจมตีหนักที่ต้องกด Y (XBOX) หรือ ปุ่มสามเหลี่ยม(PS) โดยใช้นิ้วหัวแม่มือขวา จะทำให้เราเปลี่ยนมุมกล้องด้วยแกน แอนนาล็อกด้านไม่ได้หรือไม่ถนัดเลย ทำให้การชาร์จโจมตีหนักนั้น ก้านคอของตัวละครจะกลายเป็นอัมพาตทันทีเนื่องจากหันมุมกล้องแทบเป็นไปไม่ได้หรือได้แต่ยากมาก ๆ ซึ่งอาจต้องอาศัยนิ้วชี้ที่ไม่ถนัดเลยในการกดแทนที่พลาดไม่ได้คือระบบ Spell ที่บริโภคค่ามานาไว้คอยขัดจังหวะการโจมตีของศัตรูได้อย่างเห็นผลชะงักและพลิกให้ไพ่ของเราอยู่เหนือกว่าพวกมันได้เพียงอึดใจ ในตอนแรก Spell จะมีผลออกมาได้ไม่ค่อยดีนัก ซึ่งเราต้องอัพสกิลเพื่อให้มีประสิทธิภาพประสิทธิผลที่ดียิ่งขึ้น แต่ต้องแลกกับการไม่ได้อัพสกิลสายต่อสู้ แต่เกมค่อนข้างอิสระในการอัพพอสมควรเพื่อให้เข้ากับสไตล์การต่อสู้ของเราเอง แต่ใช่ว่ามาถึงจะอัพค่ามานา 5เลเวลแรกเลยนะ เดี๋ยวช่วงแรกจะไม่มีท่าคอมโบใช้สู้ใด ๆ เลยเด้อต่อมาก็เป็นระบบเครื่องสวมใส่ เกมนี้จะไม่ได้เป็นการสุ่มดรอปอย่างเกม Soulslike ทั่ว ๆ ไป แต่จะเป็นการคราฟท์แบบตายตัวเมื่อคุณพิชิตบอสได้สำเร็จ อาวุธและชุดเกราะใหม่ถึงจะถูกปลดล็อกมาให้คราฟท์ได้ ไอเทมคราฟท์หาได้ตามหีบในฉากที่ซ่อนอยู่ หรือบ้างก็ดรอปจากมอนสเตอร์หรือว่าพวกมินิบอสกับบอส ส่วน Will(ค่าเงินในเกม) จะได้จากการดูดวิญญาณสีเขียวเข้าน้ำเต้าจากการสังหารศัตรู (แอบเหมือนเกม Onimusha เหมือนกันแฮะ) โดยค่า Will จะใช้ในการซื้อไอเทมหรือใช่เป็นค่าอัพเกรดอาวุธชุดเกราะหรือวิญญาณที่ช่วยเราต่อสู้ได้อีกด้วย และด้วยวิธีการอัพเกรดที่ล็อกตายตัวของเกมนี้ ทำให้เราไม่ได้รู้สึกเก่งขึ้นเมื่อเจอบอสที่เก่งขึ้นตัวถัดไป เพียงแค่ไม่ได้ทำให้เรากระจอกลงเท่านั้นเอง ครั้นจะเก็บเลเวลให้สูง ๆ ไปสู้กับมันก็ใช้เวลานาน เพราะศัตรูอยู่กระจายไม่กระจุกซึ่งเสียเวลาโดยใช่เหตุ สรุปได้ว่าอย่างไรเสียเกมนี้ก็ต้องพึ่งฝีมือถึง 50%เลยทีเดียว 30% เป็นทักษะที่เราอัพ 10%เป็นไอเทมสวมใส่ และอีก10% ค่าน้ำเต้าเพิ่มพลังน้ำเต้าเพิ่มพลังเกมนี้มีลูกเล่นอยู่บ้างเล็กน้อย โดยเราสามารถเลือกรูปแบบน้ำเต้าให้มีออพชั่นเสริม หลังจากนั้นก็มีให้เลือกรูปแบบน้ำยาได้อีกว่าต้องการให้มีผลการฟื้นฟูเลือดอย่างไร สุดท้ายคล้าย ๆ กับเพิ่มลูกกลอนในตัวน้ำยาไว้เพิ่มบัฟหลังจากที่ดื่มน้ำเต้าไป การจะอัพเกรดได้จำเป็นต้องใช้ไอเทมเฉพาะมาอัพ มันจะเป็นผลเหลือง ๆ ของต้นไม้ที่มีศัตรูโหด ๆ เฝ้าแทบทุกต้นเลย เป็นการบอกกลาย ๆ ว่าถ้าอยากเก่งขึ้นคุณต้องเก่งกว่ามันให้ได้เสียก่อน นอกจากน้ำเต้าจะช่วยดูดวิญญาณศัตรูในเกมแล้ว ยังดูดวิญญาณเราให้คอยหาค่า Will มาอัพพวกนี้อีกด้วยสิเนี่ย(ให้ตายสิ)Spirit หรือวิญญาณจากศัตรูที่ได้จากการสังหารนั้น เราสามารถสวมใส่เพื่อเรียกใช้เป็นสกิลมาโจมตีศัตรูได้ เราจะได้ Spirit จากศัตรูพิเศษโดยสังเกตได้จากศัตรูที่ติดไฟสีฟ้ารอบตัวและจะเก่งกาจกว่าปกติเล็กน้อย แต่ละแบบจะมีเพียงตัวเดียวเท่านั้น ฉะนั้นเดินหาให้ทั่ว ๆ จะเป็นการดีที่สุด แต่หากคุณพลาด สามารถเดินทางกลับได้ตลอดเวลาด้วยศาลเจ้า และ Relic ที่ได้รับหลังจากชนะบอสประจำฉากจะสามารถเลือกความสามารถติดตัวได้ 1ข้อ จาก 1ใน3ข้อเสียของเกมคงไม่เหมาะสำหรับผู้เล่นที่ได้อัพสกิลแล้วรู้สึกว่าต้องสู้ได้ง่ายขึ้น สำหรับเกมนี้คืออัพสกิลแล้วสู้ไม่ง่ายขึ้น แต่สู้ได้ลื่นไหลขึ้น จังหวะต่อเนื่องมากขึ้นเท่านั้น ส่วนการอัพอาวุธและชุดเกราะไม่ค่อยหลากหลายสักเท่าไหร่ และออพชั่นเซ็ทบางชุดไม่ค่อยเห็นผลอย่างมีนัยยะสำคัญมากนัก และด้วยข้อนี้อาจจะไม่ค่อยมีแรงจูงใจในการให้เรารู้สึกอยากฟาร์มหาอาวุธหรือไอเทมอัพเกรดที่ทำให้รู้สึกสู้ได้ง่ายขึ้นเลย แต่ข้อด้อยนี้ก็ได้ถูกกลบลงไปด้วยเนื้อเรื่องที่น่าติดตามและสกิลที่ให้อัพค่อนข้างหลากหลาย หากไม่ซีเรียสเรื่องบัคแสงเงาบางฉาก และถ้าอยากฝึกแนว Sekiro เพื่อเพิ่มความนิ่งทางสภาวะจิตใจให้แนวแน่กับการลงแรงนิ้วกดปุ่มจอยเพื่อหลบหลีกอย่างสมบูรณ์แบบให้ดีขึ้น แต่ขณะเดียวกันก็ไม่อยากเสียค่า EPX เวลาตายแบบเกม Soulslike อื่น ๆ อย่าง Darksoul ต้องมานั่งวิ่งไล่เก็บศพอีก ก็ขอให้เกมนี้เป็นตัวเลือกแรก ๆ ในอ้อมกอดไว้ใน Steam เลย หรืออย่างน้อยเอาไปดองเกลือใน ID ไปก่อนก็ยังถือว่ากำไรชีวิตขอรับคะแนนความพึงพอใจส่วนตัวคือ 8/10 และเหตุผลที่หักคะแนนไป 2คะแนนได้แก่1. 0.5 มุมกล้องทำออกมาได้แคบ2. 0.5 ความหลากหลายของอาวุธชุดเกราะ3. 0.5 Spirit ที่เอาจริง ๆ ไม่ค่อยได้ใช้ประโยชน์4. 0.5 กำแพงอากาศเยอะเกินไปปล.ตัวเกมมีออพชั่นปรับเปลี่ยนไอคอนจอยให้ด้วย ระหว่าง XBOX และ PS ใครคุ้นชินอันไหนก็ปรับกันได้ตามสะดวกเลย ชอบตรงนี้มาก

review: Product received for free I've finished the campaign and have a few more hours. I have some additional points I want to add while still maintaining my original points. I have friends to play with but a lot of the time I only have so much time or I just want to play alone. Steam having this in the single player category with the tag and, the promises of the devs to be able to progress solo caught my attention. Especially with this having a huge emphasis on co-op, that got me incredibly interested. That's the kind of basis I'd like to start with. Obviously these are just my points and opinions. Feel free to disagreeBad Points are:-SM2 has tried on every startup to install EOS. You can stop the installation if you'd like but I've read that it is tied and, essential to cross-platform play. It's an odd choice when most pc players (I think) will be on Steam based on the community consensus of Epic-Data Collection is on and required by default. You cannot disagree to the prompt in game. Lord knows what kind of data is actually being collected, as I'm sure is defined somewhere in the fine print like usual. This is plainly unacceptable.-Progression is tied to online services. I don't believe this applies to the campaign, I repeat this doesn't affect the campaign but, you won't be leveling up your classes while offline. I've seen a lot of people try to say based off of that, that this isn't a Live Service game. You will be wasting your time, you will not be progressing if you don't play online. Online services are a core part of this game. I absolutely hate Live Service games bc, one bad patch, one bad decision from the devs could potentially destroy the game and it's future. Helldivers 2 is a good example of being the biggest, best and fan favorite game of the year quickly turning into a very unenjoyable one. This Live Service model needs to go.-Playing solo is not possible while maintaining your online status in the Operations Gamemode. You're forced into a server, and to play with others. The devs stated it would be possible to play alone and make progress but, to my knowledge it isn't possible at this time. So if you're short on time, like to play casually, or just want to play alone, it will not be possible.-You cannot customize your Space Marine in the campaign or use classes. There are pre-applied skins that you can use with Titus in the campaign but to my knowledge the only skin I've seen, comes with the ultimate edition. Nor can you use classes in the campaign. The campaign will most likely be a sort of intro into the game and it's mechanics for most players and will be untouched after completion.-There is really not a lot of content to play through right now. You will get bored very quickly grinding the same missions repeatedly. Do expect more content in the future but I would wait a few months.-I personally do not care for the most of the classes, nor their abilities. I liked tactical and sniper but I cannot stand the equipment that you are limited to with some of the other classes. I didn't watch this game like a hawk as some did but, when I first picked it up, I didn't think the classes would be so neutered in what weapons they're able to equip. Especially after finishing the campaign, I felt extremely limited in my options.-The performance in my experience isn't terrible but it's extremely inconsistent. My GPU and CPU will jumping all over the place. My FPS never got over 60-65 no matter what settings I tried. I have an good pc and even then, I don't like running my system too hard. I couldn't find a nice middle ground between performance and visuals. Definitely going to need some smoothing out.-The melee combat is rough in my experience. The horrid key-binds make it worse but after remedying that, I found that hitting parry to the blue prompts, or dodging the red ones, half the time didn't register. There's always the possibility of human error here but it seems I am not the only one experiencing this.-As for the editions, there's only one other than the base edition that I even consider. If you'd like to get the season pass as well as some of the skins, I would recommend the Gold Edition but, the Ultimate Edition (UE) is plainly disappointing. Especially since the skins are not universal. Ex. Titus's skin from the UE can't be used in Operations or PvP. The only class-based skin you get is, I believe, for the heavy class only and, that can't be used in the campaign. You get three other skins I think for certain weapons but again, they're not universal so I can't exactly say it's worth it. Just do not buy the UE. It simply isn't worth it. I bought the Ultimate Edition for a hefty discount from another store. I'd advise looking into that if you still want the UE but $100, heck even the $90 Gold edition just to play the game early, get the season pass and, a few skins is not enough to justify that price tag. Absolutely outrageous. The Good Points are:-The game's performance isn't great but I didn't experience crashes like a lot of others did. I have crashed maybe once. There were times when I thought a bunch of stuttering would lead to more crashes but they didn't. I'm reading that some people can't get past the first cut scene... -The gunplay feels great. The variety between the guns not so much but the smooth reload animations and everything looks really good.-The graphics are beautiful. The devs really knocked it out of the park.-The Campaign's story although very short, is great. I am not very fluent in Warhammer lore so I can't say how it is lore wise but, I was happy with it.I have much more criticisms of this game than I have praise but, this review will turn to positive when the devs smooth out the performance, rebalancing the classes is a must IMO as some are quite bad. then to deliver on promises of playing solo for us solo players and the casuals. This is a typical game where the devs say it'll have features and, performance etc. just not at launch... give us a few weeks and then it'll be the game you were promised. Ultimately, it's up to you to decide but I would wait a few weeks... even months then check back in.

review: 2022 UPDATE 2.1 The very first patch after the second part of the game dropped a few days ago, and guess what, did they use that update to fix bugs, there are still bugs that have been in this game since warhammer 2. So they ignored all of those and focused on "FIXING" ppl playing the game in a way CA didn't like, were they having fun yes, did CA like that, no. Everything about Immortal empires that is fun, is stuff that was fun in warhammer 2, everything that is bad, broken or bugged is stuff that shoved in for warhammer 3. Magic and the buff that improve magic that heroes have just don't work at all, but oh no ppl are using the only spells that are working well! Got to nerf those, while 90% of magic is trash or broken. The choice of what they are focusing on, really makes me sad. I loved warhammer 2 but this game and all the bad choices as well as how they keep draining the fun out of the game. They limit the play styles, file of the edges of the A-symmetry that made this game better then any other total war, that made the races feel so different and fun to play. I played warhammer 2 nonstop for years, and I don't think I can even played for another 2 weeks of warhammer 3, these patches and dlc are so depressing and lacking. I took a break after playing for 2 weeks after launch because of how bad it was, came back and tried mods to fix some of the game, but it wasn't enough, so i waited for immortal empires. I don't have to deal with that crappy game design that they put in for warhammer 3, I can just play the races form warhammer 2 but nope, they hit them all with that same stick. LIKE REALLY maybe these new ideas that you are bringing to warhammer 3 ARE BAD and maybe ppl just wanted warhammer 2 with some new races and some quality of life tweeks and some actual bug fixes, not this, not feeling sad as every single race, has had big chunks carved out of it by a dev team that doesn't even know what made warhammer 2 good and warhammer 3 bad, and who still haven't learned that lesson going of what they prioritised in the patch.... 2 week after launch: This is ROME 2 with all the bugs and all the heartless cash grab, nice to see CA hasn't changed one bit. Still willing to use and abuse its fans. Never trust CA, every time it looks like they are getting better, they drop a buggy unfinished mess on the fans, with an uncaring smile an their faces. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. wait 2 years and a steep discount if you really want it. Maybe you might get a complete game, at least you got it for cheap. I've played ever faction, and most of the time, towards the end, its just hitting turn end, with allies on every boarder. You can't be at TOTAL WAR, nope you best army and best leader has to nope out every 25 turns, so enjoy your total board game just like CA designed it to be. This game feels like a hate letter from CA to every total war fan.

review: *no spoilers* I'm at the end of the third act now, but I can already say with confidence it is one of the best games released in recent years. Great graphics and detailed environment, interesting combat system with different combat stances, skills tree, crafting, fascinating setting, story and awesome cutscenes. I found the game quite challenging, but once you start to understand the combat system, it becomes much easier. In the beginning the game seems very linear with nothing to do, but closer to the 2nd act things change a lot. Locations are getting a lot bigger and more interesting. The game highly encourages exploration of locations and there is a lot of hidden content, different side quests, optional bosses and such, even sometimes very useful game mechanics are hidden behind side quests (the hub with the blacksmith). It's not dark souls or elden ring, but something closer to sekiro + god of war, it feels like the whole game is made up of fights with bosses, but they don't feel like just an asset flip, most of them have unique visuals and move sets. Game is worth its money, the developers have done a very good job, and such games should be supported. Definitely recommend it, 10/10.

review: 2022 This is probably the best game I've played in literal years, not only that, but it's probably one of the best games I've ever played in my life. It's the amalgamation of practically all the previous Fromsoft/Souls games, every feature, every design, every skill they've honed over the course of years making these games, put into a gigantic and incredibly immersive world where you're constantly being rewarded for adventuring out on your own. I think it's pretty safe to say that we just don't get games like this anymore, especially without a flood of micro-transactions and other "pay for convenience" abominations that have plagued games the last 8 years. This is just a good ass game, full stop. It's one of those games that not only lived up to to hype, but somehow managed to exceed it in a lot of ways.

review: You block/roll a string of 12 attacks with the bosses flailing and jumping and flipping and breaking your target lock, you see they've probably finished their string and try to get in one R1, but little did you know there was an unreactable delayed AOE explosion at the end of the string to punish your attempt to get the tiniest bit of damage. Or maybe they fling their sword up in the air for twelve seconds and catch you rolling with some absurd, clearly-designed-to-♥♥♥♥-with-you delay. Which boss did I just describe? Most of them. The only advancement to your moveset in this game from Souls is the ability to jump, and almost no enemies use that as a mechanic. Every weapon art that isn't bloodhound step or raptor is virtually useless against the bosses. Torrent isn't available for bosses often enough, and is often straight up worse than being on foot. You don't get to do anything cool, the boss just does all the cool ♥♥♥♥ to you. These bosses would be way more fun in a game that expands what your character is capable of, like Sekiro, Nioh, or Monhun. I've beaten the game four times, and just finished the DLC. I'm not bad at the game. They've just cranked up boss health bars and damage and movesets to an absurd degree, and left the player character with the same roll, block and attack they've been using since Demon's Souls.Now that I'm done with the DLC, I'll probably never boot up and replay this game ever again, which is a shame. I want to love this game, it's just too much of a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ slog to ever do again.

review: This game is very promising. However, in it's current state I simply cannot recommend it. The mechanics are awesome, the combat is great but there are some issues I would like to address. I'll make it simple.PROS:-Visually great.-Good Audio.-Engaging crafting and resource gathering.-Creative story and enemies.-Seamless co-op play.-Large map.-Base Building and resource management.-Combat is fun and intuitive.CONS:-Horrible Network Issues.-Lag and desync even on the closest servers.-Janky combat due to desync issues.-Korean servers offer better connection than NA servers. (I don't know why)-Low ping does not equal steady connection.-Player animations like resource gathering is buggy. I.E chopping down trees and mining ore will not show properly, Your equipped weapon will default as the pickaxe.-Game wipes every six weeks leaving casual players and those who work feeling left out. -Screen tearing when looking at sky. (Only sometimes)Conclusion: Although the game has it's issues it shows promise for the future. Many of the issues I addressed can be fixed with updates and most likely will. However, the lag and desync will take most of the joy out of your experience. I wanted to continue to play but could not get myself to overlook this issue. It seems like you can manage it until you go to fight enemies and than it really becomes annoying. The elephant in the room must be addressed. Why make your game wipe in six weeks? I understand that PvP might need that to avoid new players being discouraged, I would still like to think that it is to early. The game has a very solid foundation, but these issues need to be addressed.

review: Elden Ring Every review is subjective and aligns with the perception, tastes, and/or interests of the person writing it. I’m someone who views video games as another form of artistic expression, which is why I do NOT assign a score. I don't believe art can be measured or quantified. I’ll simply share my personal experience while avoiding spoilers as much as possible. Elden Ring is essentially a culmination of everything FromSoftware has refined over the years in their previous titles, wrapped in a vast open world that invites exploration and discovery. If I could describe Elden Ring in one word, it would be "Lost." Like other FromSoftware games, this one is filled with moments where you’re not entirely sure what you’re doing, who the enemies are that you’re fighting, why they’re there, where you should go, or what the correct path is. Yet, that sense of being lost isn’t frustrating; it’s a driving force that pushes you to keep going. There’s something magnetic that urges you to press forward, to explore every corner of the map in search of an NPC, an item, or any clue that might give you some direction. But as you progress, things only become more convoluted. When you finally defeat an enemy, a tougher one appears. When you think you’ve grasped a part of the lore, new information emerges that forces you to rethink everything. The game constantly keeps you in a state of uncertainty, wondering whether you’ve taken the right path or strayed into a dangerous detour.The only clear indicators of progress in Elden Ring are the boss fights, a few scattered dialogues, and some of the graces placed across the map. The sense of accomplishment from defeating a boss is unparalleled, it serves as a reminder that despite the confusion and challenges, you are making progress.One of the standout aspects of Elden Ring is the sheer size and richness of its world. In open-world games, I’ve always enjoyed exploring every last corner of each zone, and this title was no exception. The world’s vastness, both visually and in terms of content, is impressive. The thrill of discovering a new area or finding a well-hidden secret is what drives me to keep playing. However, as I explored, I encountered one of the game’s most criticized aspects: repeated bosses. While it’s a common practice in some games, I expected FromSoftware to maintain their unique touch of originality. Perhaps the decision to reuse bosses was driven by the ambition to make the world as large as possible in their first attempt at an open-world game. Personally, I wouldn’t mind it as much if these bosses became increasingly challenging or had new attack patterns, but in most cases, the fights feel nearly identical. Despite this shortcoming, the overall experience wasn’t “tarnished” (xD), I thoroughly enjoyed every battle, striving to improve with each encounter. Erdtree The Erdtree expansion brings new mechanics and a narrative focus that complements the base experience of Elden Ring. When I first accessed the expansion, I thought it would be similar to the DLCs in the studio’s other games: having a high level would be enough… I was wrong. Erdtree introduces a unique mechanic that intertwines with the game’s lore. If you choose to ignore that detail, be prepared to suffer like never before. What’s fascinating is how this expansion not only adds content but also manages to maintain the essence of what makes Elden Ring special while expanding its world in a way that feels natural. Despite all the new content, both Elden Ring and Erdtree are, in my opinion, the most accessible and, to some extent, the easiest experiences FromSoftware has developed. That’s not to say they lack challenge, but the open-world design, with its emphasis on exploration and freedom, somewhat softens the experience.In conclusion, I can confidently say that Elden Ring is the best game they’ve created in terms of ambition, design, and execution. However, interestingly, it’s not my favorite. Despite everything I’ve mentioned, I don’t feel the desire to replay it, cause it feels like a one-time experience. This contrasts with Bloodborne, my favorite game from the studio, which I could play over and over again. Despite being technically inferior in several ways, Bloodborne has an atmosphere and design that I find more appealing and invites me to a better "dream".

review: 2022 I have been a fan of Total War games since Shogun 1 and have particularly enjoyed Total Warhammer 1 & 2. Unfortunately, this is just really, really disappointing.I'm not quite sure what they were thinking with the changes they made because almost all the changes are for the worse compared to WH2.The new settlement towers and barricades? Pure cancer. The towers in particular are utterly unbalanced and make every battle a slog. I say every battle rather than just "siege battles" because the AI absolutely refuse to fight you on the open field unless they outnumber you hugely. I've had three open field battles in 6 hours of play. Big, fun set-piece battles are meant to be the centrepiece of this game and this one fails at it's most fundamental level.The new mechanic where rifts into chaos randomly appear in your territories every turn? One of the most annoying mechanics they could have devised. Not only is there no way to prevent this but they take your provinces from 0 to 100 corruption in three turns, discourge enemy agents into your lands and often enemy armies. This means that the only viable tactic is to turtle and spam end turn since, if you expand, you cannot protect your provinces properly.The game economy is broken. This makes having more than one army nearly impossible (especially due to the necessary turtling) and good luck saving enough money to get decent settlements unless you farm Slaanesh's rewards.Does it have good AI? LOLNO, all AI factions at war will make a beeline for the player no matter how stupid it is to do so. This has always been an issue but it's so much worse in WH3. The AI also outright and blatantly cheats in respect of the main quest (you can watch it do so in front of your eyes) but, even worse, if they collect all the souls before you that is an instant game over and there is no option to buy more time by defeating them in battle.The UI? Far inferior to the WH2 one.Optimisation? It runs like a legless paraplegic on a floor made of needles. Look forward to constant graphical glitches and stuttering.Bugs? Quite a few game breaking ones but you'll only find out after having wasted several hours on a campaign.I am going to have to ditch the game until the big combined map comes out or until there is mod support to get rid of the many, many issues because the gameplay is actively anti-fun at present and that is coming from someone who actually quite liked the Vortex campaign in WH2 (which a lot of people complained about).Very sadly, this is the first TW game that I simply cannot recommend. Hopefully they'll fix some of this in patches but I suspect that much of it is unfixable because it represents inexplicable design decisions which would need to be redesigned from the ground up. Regardless, I'll keep an open mind and I hope that I can change this review to a positive at a later date.

review: 2020 CS2 is a wasteland... a barren expanse of futile efforts, as frivolous as a cocktail umbrella in a storm. Picture this: legions of developers hunched over their screens, burning the midnight oil to crank out .. a sequel. A mirage of innovation. Skins, stickers and cases are not forged from the tears of unicorns. Face reality, you're not an investor.. you're a gambler and the house always wins.The players are a motley crew of keyboard warriors, so embroiled in their virtual skirmishes that they've forgotten the taste of fresh air. It's a circus, and not the kind with clowns and cotton candy. No, this is a circus of squeakers, where the ringmaster has lost control and the animals are running amok.CS2 in all its glory, or lack thereof, is a monumental waste of time. I'll see you in there.
